loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. Since 2005, she has been making and selling detergent at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make a profit of about US $4.00 every day. Her husband is a bus driver for a private company. On average, he is able to make US $2.00 in profits each day. Sok S. is asking for a loan of US $1000.00 to purchase materials to make detergent.

loans.use: Buy materials to make detergent.

loans.name: Hoàng's Group

texts.en:
K. Hoàng Thị (10102090016) is a 34 year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. K. is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Xóm Mít (4).

K. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, K. works in a manufacturing business that is owned by someone else. The business makes and sells manufactured products to local businesses and community members.  K. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.972.000 VND from SEDA. She used her previous loan to purchase machinery to expand the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND to purchase machinery to expand the business. This will be the K.'s 4th loan from SEDA.  K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Khơ (10102090020) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.322.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (10102090018) is a 53 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.886.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị N. (10102090015) is a 27 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.578.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


K. Hoàng Thị (10102090016) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  K. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xóm Mít (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm được chế tạo thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  K. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2005, K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  K. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.972.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Khơ (10102090020) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.322.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (10102090018) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.886.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị N. (10102090015) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase machinery to expand the business

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and seeking his first loan from a microfinance institution. He has been running a phone accessories/electronics business for three years. He wants a loan to buy phone accessories and other popular items for his shop so he can keep up with demand. Now, he runs out of inventory. 

Peter's shop is located in Kangemi in a busy market area. He can see up to twenty clients within thirty minutes. Peter's goal is to open another shop and expand his phone/electronics business to other locations.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories and items for his phone and electronics shop

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min S. is 37 years old and lives with three of her children and her husband in Phnom Penh. Since 2007, she has been selling wine to earn a living and is able to make about US $1.00 of profit every day. Her husband is a mechanic who fixes motorbikes. On average, he is able to make around US $10.00 in revenue each day. Min S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 to buy her tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's motorbike repair business

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun R., 48, has her own small farming business which she learned from her grandfather. Her main activity is planting a variety of crops. Roeun R. also takes time to fish with her husband along the river for additional profit. The family lives with five single children, and one of their children is married and has ready started new home. Roeun R. will be using her loan to buy more fishing tools to fish as well as purchase more fertilizers and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools to fish as well as more fertilizers and seeds for growing.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun N., age 43, is a widow with 4 children. She resides in Phnom Penh Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells a kind of Cambodian cake, earning an income of US $6.00 per day in revenue. Her family is also assisted by two of her children who are construction workers. N.'s income and the income of her children help to cover the family's expenses. 

N. is seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children so he can commute to work at a rubber tree farm in the province. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike so her child can commute to work

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the village of Tucal in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Fe's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adebukola

texts.en:
Adebukola has been with LAPO for over three years now. She is 41 years old and married to an estate surveyor.  They already have three children.
She is into sales of cooked food and drinks. She started the business 12 years ago, and she hopes to own a big restaurant in the future where her customers can have a feel off continental and African dishes. She also sells and supplies sarongs (women's clothing). With her combined businesses, she is able to support her family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan of NGN 100,000, she plans to expand her restaurant business and purchase more sarongs. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for her children's education. She says thank you to Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs and food materials to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
A. Nguyễn Thị (10102050010) is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông A. - Hà Nội. A. is the leader of a 2-member loan group loan sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xóm Hương (3). A. is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, A. operates a family member's livestock business where she raises pigs for sale. A. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities. In 2004, A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.148.000 VND from SEDA. She used her previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise & sell. She is now requesting a loan of 6.322.000 VND to buy piglets to raise & sell. This will be A.'s 6th loan from SEDA. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. The other borrower in the group is Trương Thị H. (10102050011), a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her service-based business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.148.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lak

texts.en: Lak M., age 27, is a widow with a young child who lives in Phnom Penh. She is a massage supervisor and makes US $10.00 in profits each day. She wants to operate a massage club by herself, which would cost her about USD $2000. She would like to take a loan of US $1000 to open a massage club in a beauty salon.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Manh L. is 47 years old and currently lives with her four nephews in a rural area of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a single woman and makes a living by catching fish to sell. All four of her nephews assist her in catching fish. They normally fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. They sell their fish to middlemen who then take them to sell in the market. Recently, many of their fishing tools were ruined, and their income has been effected. Because of that, Manh L. decided to ask for a loan of $600, which is her second loan. She will buy more equipment for her fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her fishing activities.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is from the city of Santa Cruz in Tarlac. She is 30 years old. Joyce is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joyce sells soft drinks in the local community. Joyce has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Joyce joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from ASKI that she used to buy more products to sell. Joyce is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Joyce's 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
B. Nguyen Thị (10102140027) is a 35 year-old women living in the town of Đông Anh,  Hànội.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, B. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  B. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.142.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  B. is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & resell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Bie from SEDA.  B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Emma is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling retail products such as shampoo, soap, edible oil, toothpaste etc., Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional produts to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional produts to sell

loans.name: Bolajoke

texts.en: Bolajoke is 35 years of age, married with two kids. She sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She started this business 11 years ago in order to support her family by providing the basic necessities of life in the little way she could. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks in large quantity that will increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of 4 unemployed children. In 2007, she decided to begin a home based business and work as a tailor for woman clothing. She has 20 years of experience in this field. Her business reputation has become well known throughout the whole region. Today, Wafaa is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a new tailoring machine to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia N. is from the village of Catarman , Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Virginia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pouch

texts.en: Pouch S. is a 29-year-old married man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is a security guard who works in the public garden. He started his job more than a year ago. Pouch S. is blessed with two young kids who are not enrolled in school. His wife works as cleaning staff and also spends time at home to take care of the kids and do homework. This family’s living conditions are not so good because their house is surrounded by bad water that may affect their health. To solve the problem, Pouch S. requested a loan to buy dirt to cover the water that surrounds his house.

loans.use: To buy dirt to cover the water that surrounds his house.

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 39 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. Adenike is a hair dresser, and she has a salon where she styles hair and sells hair extensions and hair cream. For over 14 years now she has been running the business. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to improve her business and purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing accessories to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing accessories to sell.

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is a focused, hard worker who sells ladies' clothing and underwear. She is a devoted member of Shalom Union in LAPO Microfinance. She is 42 years old, and married with three children. Her husband is a civil servant. She has a store in a nearby market where she sells her products. She needs a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more ladies' underwear to sell in her store. She believes that having an assortment of ladies' underwear and clothing that is both practical and of good quality will increase her sales. She offers a very big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' underwear to sell.

loans.name: Eo's Group

texts.en:
Eo Thị K. is a 36 year-old woman living in the town of Đông Anh - Hànoi.  She is the group leader of a 4-member loan group with SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Lê Xá (4).

K. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, K. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  K. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Mrs Thi K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mrs Thi K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by this borrower from SEDA.  K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Hoàng Thị C. (10110030035) is a 45 year-old lady who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Tạ Thị Lý (10110030031) is a 44 year-old lady who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Trần Thị C. (10110030032) is 33 year-old. She is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda B.'s main source of income comes from selling Dakki products like pillows and ready-to-wear items. They also have a motorcycle and offer transportation services in their community. She is 46 years old, married and has eight school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Minda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2009, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase products to sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. is 47 years old and a basket seller. She has been selling the bamboo baskets that she weaves since early 2007. She normally earns US$1.50 per day to feed her family. She is married and has three children, all of whom are no longer in school. One of her children works for a bread company and the other two are basket makers. Her husband stays at home to help braid the baskets. The family’s living situation is not comfortable because the wooden wall in their house is broken. Therefore, Chan S. is applying for a loan to replace the broken wall in her existing house.

loans.use: To replace the broken wall in her existing house

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en: Olubunmi, 35 and married with a child, sells jewelery such as rings, bracelets and necklaces; she also sells clothes, including sarongs. Operating this business for over seven years now, she is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase clothes and jewelry in bulk to get a better price. Olubunmi hopes that this loan will help make her business more profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo, a member of LAPO Microfinance, is excited to take a Kiva loan with LAPO. Forty-six years old and the mother of three children, she is married to Mr. A., an automobile mechanic. She is the owner of Iya-beji Cool Spot, a beer parlour where her customers come to relax with bottles of drinks, beers and soft drinks. She also sells drinks wholesale.

Titilayo has been a client of LAPO for over two years and is now requesting a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks in large quantities to sell. She says she needs more money to purchase stock during this festive period when people buy more drinks. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet S. currently weaves bamboo baskets, selling her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house and then take them to sell at the market. She generally makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out and also orders baskets from the other villagers to sell for additional income. Her husband helps with the family expenses by working in construction. In the past, Chet S. and her family faced difficulties with their sanitation because their house doesn’t have a bathroom, so she has decided to ask for a loan to build a new bathroom.

loans.use: To build a new bathroom

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 52 years old. Francisco is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Francisco has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Francisco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Francisco from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 37 years of age, married, and has three children. Taiwo sells drinks by wholesale and retail. She started the business about six years ago, and she has been in LAPO for three years now. She purchases her drinks from Ikeja and Ikosi. According to Taiwo, her profit is over NGN 30,000 per month. She buys drinks over NGN 40,000 every week, which makes her goods demanding. She is therefore requesting a loan amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more drinks to sell and to make more profit to support her family’s basic needs. She believes that having an assortment of drinks will increase her sales this festive period. Thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang D. is 26 years old and lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a good housewife who cooks delicious meals for her family. To earn a living, she owns and operates a grocery business in front of her home, where she can earn approximately $4 per day to feed her family. Neang D. is married with two kids. They are students who also help sell her inventory when they are not going to school. She currently resides with her husband, who works as a local electrician.

In addition to her grocery business, Neang D. also cultivates a rice crop that she plants as annual business. For the upcoming farming season, Neang D. needs a loan of 500 USD to pay for the cost of plowing her farmland and purchasing fertilizer and rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of plowing her farmland and purchasing fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence owns an electronic store where she sells electrical goods and parts such as pliers, plugs, sockets, screwdrivers, wires etc. She has been a member of LAPO for three years now. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. He repairs different kinds of vehicles. Her dream is to see her family living comfortably, having all the basic necessities of life and for her children to have a good education. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more electrical goods as well as electrical parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods and parts to sell.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Sary S. is a long-time businesswoman who sells charcoal and mature coconuts to earn a living. She is married to Mr. Teng Buthoeun, age 48. Mr. Bhuthoeun owns an old car and he provides a taxi service. This couple has been married many years and they have three school-aged children. Sary S. is taking out her loan to buy a piece of farmland, in a good location, for farming. She will rent the land to other farmers and charge rental fees.

loans.use: To buy a piece of farmland to rent out to farmers.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say S., 29, is a local rice grower living in the rural area of Kampong Chhnang province. She was married, but divorced her husband when her four kids were very young. Say S. needs a loan to buy rice in bulk from other farmers and then she will sell it to raise income when the rice commands highest prices.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from other farmers.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is excited about taking her first Kiva loan with LAPO. She has been in LAPO for three years now. Bola is 49 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a trader; he sells building materials. Bola is into the sale of drinks; soft drinks, and beers in both wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for a very long time and is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000. She plans to expand her business of selling drinks, which is now booming. With this business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide for her children's education. Thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nassiba

texts.en: Nassiba is a 60-year-old widow. She has been working in tailoring and sewing for the past 23 years. After the death of her husband, she became the only provider for her only child. Today Nassiba is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine and tools needed for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and tools

loans.name: Hoàng's Group

texts.en:
L. Hoàng Thị B. (10110040037) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  L. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Lộc Hà (4).


L. is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L. operates a family member's business venture running a general store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.436.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. O. (10110040039) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her clothing business.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (10110040041) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.962.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10110040040) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Đồng Thị H. (10110040038) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Hoàng Thị B.  (10110040037) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Lộc Hà (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.436.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. O. (10110040039) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. quần áo.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (10110040041) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.962.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. sản xuất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10110040040) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Đồng Thị H. (10110040038) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr: T. Caroline est née le 27 Mai 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Caroline vit au quartier Zogbohouè à Cotonou, depuis une dizaine d'année. Mariée à DANSOU Olivier un architecte, Caroline est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Caroline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. C'est le mari de Caroline qui assure le plus les charges de la famille. Cependant, Caroline vient en aide à son mari dans l'entretien et l'éducation des enfants, grâce aux revenus issus de son activité. Caroline a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Caroline a appris ensuite le métier de couture et l'exerce depuis environs 17 ans. A côté de cela, Caroline vend des tissus dans son atelier situé à son domicile. Caroline s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Caroline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de l'institution, et qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est pour remplacer ses machines à coudre qui sont usées, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Caroline sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Caroline T. was born on the 27th of May, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Caroline has lived in the Zogbohouè quarter for around ten years. She is married to Olivier Dansou, an architect, with whom she has four children – all are school-educated. Caroline lives with her children and her husband, who looks after most of the family’s needs. However, Caroline assists her husband with her children’s schooling and maintenance with the money that she earns from her business. Caroline attended school up to secondary level, after which she learned the skill of dressmaking which she has now practised for around 17 years. In addition to this, Caroline sells fabric from her home studio. She sources her goods from Lomé in the Togo, Benin’s neighbouring State, and also at Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Caroline is an existing client of ALIDé, having already received and successfully repaid three loans from the organisation. She is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to replace her heavily worn sewing machines, so that she may better satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Michael Maritim

texts.en:
Michael is married and is blessed with four children. He runs a retail shop in the Tarakwa area of Eldoret.

With the loan he is taking from KADET, he intends to buy more stock including sugar, baking flour, rice and cooking fat. God willing, he intends to grow his shop to be a wholesale shop. His future dreams are to grow his entire business and to educate his children in a higher institution of learning.

loans.use: To buy stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde sells foodstuffs and eggs. She is married with four children, and she is 54 years old. Her husband is a Dry-cleaner. She hopes that her business will grow bigger in the future, and improve her family's standard of living. She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000. She will use this loan to invest in her business of selling drinks and eggs. She will buy in bulk to get a better price. Kehinde hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Damdinsuren

texts.en: Damdinsuren B. is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Gobi-Altai Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter has finished school and is working, his son is serving in the Mongolian army, and his youngest daughter is a secondary school student. B. sells firewood and operates a taxi service in his town with the help of his wife. He drives a taxi and his wife is responsible for selling firewood. B. started his firewood business in 2004 with a loan of 200,000 tugrugs (~$140 USD) from Xacbank, a Mongolian microfinance institution and Kiva field partner. After succeeding in the firewood business, Bassandorj used his savings to purchase a car and start his taxi service. Today, he is working hard to continue his success for the future and says, “I would like to have my own workplace where I can sell my firewood.” He is requesting a loan of 500,000 tugrug ($350 USD) loan to purchase coal to expand his firewood business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase coal for his firewood business

loans.name: Bayarlah

texts.en: Bayarlah O. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Khovd Province in Western Mongolia. She and her family live in a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, called a "ger". Her oldest son lives with his grandparents working as a herder and her youngest son and both of her daughters are secondary school students. O. and her husband sell meat at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2002 with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 USD) and has built a consistent operation over the years. Her busines continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugrugs ($1050 USD). Oyntsetseg's business has enabled her to buy new furniture and create a confortable home for her children. She is saving now to build a new home. O. is working hard for the future and says, “I want to continue to improve my business.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug ($1050 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell in her business

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en:
Bisi is a 54 years old mother of four children. She is married to Mr. A. who is a contractor, and she is a member of LAPO. She sells jewellery such as bangles, necklaces, beads, bracelets, ear rings, other rings, etc. She is a focused, hard worker. Bisi puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. 

Bisi is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more jewellery to sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en: Dashdorj T. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Zavkhan Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger." His daughters, ages 17 and 15, are secondary school students. Tumubaatar sells firewood in his town and drives a taxi in in spare time. Firewood is an important household heating fuel in Mongolia. He gathers fallen trees and sticks from the surrounding forests. T. started his business in 2004 and has been quite successful over the years. He takes pride in his work and feels that he provides an important service for his customers. T. is focused on improving his business in the future and says, “I am working hard to feed my family.” He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug ($500 USD) loan pay his firewood transportation costs this winter. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To pay his firewood transportation costs this winter

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en: Dugersuren O. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Arkhangai Province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a yurt or "ger," which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both of her daughters have finished school. Her oldest now has her own business and her youngest is a teacher. O. raises livestock and sells meat in her town. She sells a variety of locally raised meats to her many customers. She started her business in 2003 with capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~$105 USD) and has built a successful operation over the years. Today, her business continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. Her working capital now exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~$560 USD). O. is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. For the future she says, “I hope to soon expand my business.” She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug ($350 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell in her business

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel A. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Zavkhan Province in Western Mongolia. She and her family live in a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her daughter is 20 years old and attends university. Her husband works as a driver and manages a transportation service in their town. A. sells fruits and vegetables from a small shop that she rents. She buys most of her fruit, but grows her vegetables on a 0.8 hectare (~ 2-acre) field that she owns. She harvests an average of 10-12 tons of vegetables every year. She has built a stable business and hopes to use her future earnings to purchase her own shop. She is working hard to improve her business and is focused on achieving her future goals. She says, “I want to have a successful business so I can support my daughter's education.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 ($700 USD) loan to purchase fruit to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fruit to sell in her business

loans.name: Sangi

texts.en:
Sangi S. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His son is thirteen years old and attends a local secondary school, and his four-year-old daughter will soon start kindergarten.

Sangi manages a consumer goods trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He sells a wide variety of consumer and household goods which are imported from China. S. started his business in 1998 and has built a consistent operation over the years. He has developed a loyal base of customers and works hard to adapt his business to their needs.

Sangi has used his success to make repairs to his home and improve his family's quality of life. He is focused on the future and says, "I want to move my family into an apartment one day.” He also hopes to purchase a car for them. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more products from China. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more products from China

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"T. Nguyễn Thị (10107050007) is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  T. is the group leader of a four-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Văn Thượng (5).

T. is married and has two infant children.  To make a living, T. operates a service-based business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $153 a month from this activity.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4.452.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new L. of 5.450.000 VND which will again be used to purchase needed materials.  The will be her 4th L. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Đào Thị T. (10107050011) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

2.  Lê Thị L. (10107050009) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND L. to support her service-based business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. P. (10107050008) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (10107050007) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Văn Thượng (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa P..  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND.  Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.452.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.450.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Đào Thị T. (10107050011) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.

2.  Lê Thị L. (10107050009) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. P. (10107050008) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase needed materials

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is a 24-year-old single businessman. He lives in the Gasabo district, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Bonaventure owns a retail general store in this area selling different goods that include foodstuffs, cosmetic goods and other items. He works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Having realized that his general store is lacking enough goods and new products to sell, Bonaventure is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He will use the loan to purchase additional products for his shop as well as new products that may attract a wider number of customers from his community.

Bonaventure is expecting a successful expansion through these new products. With these new products, it will enable him to save a portion of his profits earned for the future and to reinvest the rest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as cooking oil, salt, sugar and biscuits

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: P. Jeanne est née le 13 Mai 1956. Jeanne vit depuis 20 ans environs au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne est une veuve ayant à sa charge 6 enfants dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Jeanne a fréquenté jusqu'au secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeanne vend divers articles (biscuits, riz, conserves, pure water, huile végétale, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Jeanne fait ses achats. Jeanne a déjà 20 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine, et est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé. Jeanne a bien remboursé les trois crédits qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. En vue d'agrandir davantage son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle, Jeanne sollicite ce quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne P. was born on 13 May 1956. For around 20 years, Jeanne has lived in the Cadjèhoun area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Jeanne is a widow with 6 children in her care, four of whom are her own. All of her children are in school. Jeanne lives alone with her children and provides for the family by herself. Jeanne attended school up to the secondary level. To meet her different expenses, Jeanne sells various items (biscuits, rice, canned goods, pure water, vegetable oil, etc.) at her home. It is in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Jeanne makes her purchases. Jeanne already has 20 years of experience in this field, and is on her fourth loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Jeanne properly repaid the three previous loans that she obtained through ALIDÉ. With the goal of further enlarging her business to better respond to the demands of her clientele, Jeanne is seeking this fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of biscuits, canned goods, bags of rice, and cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Gulbegim

texts.en:
D. Gulbegim has an established business selling dresses and gowns for women in her store. She started her business about fifteen years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind and has worked hard to develop her business.

She is married and has four children. One of her goals for the future is to provide all of her children with houses.

She is requesting a loan of $2200 in order to purchase new goods to sell. With additional goods, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 32 years old and is married with three children aged between 4 and 17 years. She also takes care of one dependent from another family. She lives in the Nyarugenge district in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Violette has been in the retail shop business for the past three years and employs one person in this business as a helper. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Violette is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders Via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional items like cosmetic products. With this expansion, she believes she will earn more profits that will allow her to save money for building a secure future for her family and be able to continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics products for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"T. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107010029) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  T. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. Vào 2006, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.
