loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 27 years old and is married with two children, 2 years of age and below. She lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Epiphanie has been in the business of selling charcoal as a retailer for the past three years and employs three people from her community in her business. The business’s working hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily except Sunday.

Epiphanie is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more sacks of charcoal and by extending the area in which the business operates. With these funds, Epiphanie hopes to satisfy her growing number of customers from her community as well as earning more profits than previously.

Epiphanie also plans to start up a savings program for her family and to continue taking good care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Madinatou

texts.fr: S. Madinatou est née le 06 Mars 1971 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Il y a environs 6 mois que Madinatou vit au quartier Zogbohouè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une divorcée et mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Madinatou vit seule avec son enfant et supporte seule ses charges. Madinatou n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de son enfant, Madinatou mène comme activité, la vente de portables et des accessoires GSM dans sa boutique size à Fifadji à Cotonou. Madinatou s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Madinatou a commencé ce commerce, il y a environs 1 an. C'est la première fois que Madinatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d'augmenter son capital et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Madinatou S. was born on 6 March 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. For around 6 months, Madinatou has lived in the Zogbohouè area in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is divorced and the mother of one child, who is in school. Madinatou lives alone with her child and provides for the family by herself. Madinatou only attended primary school. To meet her own and her child's needs, Madinatou runs a business selling mobile phones and GSM accessories at her store located in Fifadji in Cotonou. Madinatou gets her supplies in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin,and also at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Madinatou began this business around 1 year ago. This is the first time Madinatou is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of increasing her capital and strengthening her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and GSM accessories

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 40 years old, is married with two children, and takes care of three dependents. Both the children and dependents are aged between 11 and 14 years. Francoise and her family live in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

Francoise owns a public secretariat service where she deals with different computer services, such as typing, printing, photocopying, and other services. This is her ninth successful year in the secretarial business! The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Although Francoise has been in the business for nine years, the profit is still too low for her to expand meaningfully. For that reason, she believes that additional capital would enable her business to progress. To end this, Francoise is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional computer accessories.

With this additional equipment, Francoise hopes that she will expand her business through hiring other people to assist in service delivery, as well as by improving the services provided to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer accessories

loans.name: Lhagva

texts.en:
Lhagva T. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Uvs province in western Mongolia. His four daughters attend local secondary schools.

T. operates an auto repair and machinery parts business in his town. He works together with his wife. She is responsible for selling the parts and T. is the mechanic. He specializes in repairing Korean and Japanese cars, which are the most popular automobiles in Mongolia. He started his business in 2002 after working as a mechanic for a private company for several years.

As more and more people have bought cars in Mongolia over the last ten years, T. has had a great deal of success with his business. In 2003 he built a new house, which included space for him to operate his auto repair business. He recently hired three more assistants to help keep up with growing demand. T. is focused on improving his business in the future and says, “All I want is to be able to support my children and their education.”

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase machine parts for his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts for his business

loans.name: Zagdhuu

texts.en:
Zagdhuu L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Two of her sons currently attend university and her only daughter is a secondary school student. L. and her husband operate a small grocery shop in their town, selling a variety of Mongolian and imported food products. L. started her business in 1999, at first selling only baked goods which she made at home. After having success with her baked goods she saved enough money to rent a small workroom which she now owns. L. is planning to expand her business in the near future and hopes to make a wider variety of baked goods. She is focused on supporting her children and says, “I need to save for my children's education.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and equipment for her business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 54-year-old widow with four children. She is lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali.

Marie has been in the restaurant business for the past four years. She employs three people from her community in her business and their working hours are from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. each day. They are long hours and it’s hard work but Marie has been successful so far and her restaurant is popular in the community.

Marie is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more restaurant supplies, food and beverages. With these new offerings, Marie expects to satisfy her customers' demand and attract new customers as well, hopefully. The extra funds will also give her a cushion of capital that will allow her to keep running her business smoothly in a competitive environment.

Marie plans to reinvest a portion of any profits as well as contributing to her family's well-being and improving their daily living situation.

loans.use: To purchase more restaurant supplies, food and beverages

loans.name: Sosor

texts.en:
Sosor B. is 31 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He operates a business making wooden products in his town with the help of his wife. B. designs and crafts all of the products and his wife paints and decorates them. He started his business in 2005 after learning how to make wooden products from his relatives. For most of the year, during the spring and summer, B. produces and sells his products. However, due to a lack of a proper working space, he purchases other people's products to sell during the colder months. B. has found success in his trade and his earnings have enabled him to expand his home. He is focused on the future and is always looking for ways to expand his business. This coming spring he hopes to start a new business and open a small grocery shop. He says, “I need to continue to grow and improve my businesses. ” He is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2,500 USD) loan to purchase wooden products to sell this winter. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase wooden products to sell this winter

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Mademoiselle A. owns a general store in the Hédzranawoe quarter of Lomé. She is single and has no children. She began her enterprise in 2004 and this will be her second loan with WAGES. She hopes to replenish her stock of supplies with this second loan.

She will buy 10 bags of rice, 18 bottles of oil, and other diverse products necessary to keep her business running smoothly. With the profits, she hopes to improve her personal wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: cette jeune dame 37 ans d'age est célibataire sans enfant elle habite la banlieue de la ville de Dakar précieusement dans le vieux quartier de d'Arafat.Elle est membre a la caisse de liberté 6 depuis plusieurs mois. Coiffeuse de profession elle a une expérience avérée dans le défrisage et les poses greffages "spécial fête de Tabaski".Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 F CFA pour satisfaire sa clientèle épargner pour acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
This young lady, aged 37, is unmarried and has no children. She lives a suburb of the city of Dakar, more precisely, in the old district of Arafat. She has been a member of the Liberté 6 fund for several months. A hairstylist by profession, she has proven experience in hair straightening and "special Tabaski holiday" weaves. She is seeking a loan of 400,000 FCFA to satisfy her clientele, and to save up to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaves and other hair products, working capital

loans.name: C8314 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Celestin is 45 years old and is married with three children aged 6, 9 and 12. He and his family live in the Northern Province of Rwanda in the region of Ruhengeri, which is approximately two hours drive from the capital city of Rwanda.

Celestin is the representative of a group called “Twitezimbere”, which consists of four people. Their common business is selling different products in their shop and different kinds of beer. This is their fifth successful year in this business, which they operate from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except Sunday.

This group is requesting the loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business. They will purchase more foodstuffs for sale such as sugar, beans and the other products, which seem to be highly demanded by their customers. After purchasing the additional foodstuffs, they will also increase the quantity of beers so that they can satisfy their customers.

With this expansion, the group hopes to attract more customers to their shop and hopefully earn more profits in the process. This, in turn, will allow them to build a secure future for their financial stability as well as for their families.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and beers to sell

loans.name: Atsutsé

texts.en:
Monsieur W. is a hairdresser who also sells a variety of hair products. He works in the Adidogomé region of Togo, but was born in the Agouhyogbo region. He has over ten years of experience and began his business in 1998.  He is single and has one child.

This will be his third loan with WAGES, which he will use to purchase weaves and hair relaxer. With the profits, both his personal and professional life will benefit.

loans.use: To buy weaves and hair relaxer

loans.name: Attawa Sitsofé

texts.en:
Madame M. is the secretary for her own business. She is married with one child. She primarily sells prepaid cell-phone cards, and she also manages a pay phone. She began her business in 2006 in her own home.

This will be her second loan with WAGES which she will use to replenish her stock of prepaid cell-phone cards.

loans.use: To purchase more phone cards for cellular phones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Oumran

texts.en:
Oumran is a 26-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Oumran has been selling “narguileh” and coal. A narguileh (also known as 'shisha' in Egypt) is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco.

Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe and other countries. Oumran is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase 'narguileh' and coal for his work. This is the first time that Oumran has requested a loan.

When Oumran first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase 'narguileh' (water pipes) and coal for his work

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA. is a 32-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. JamA. has been installing aluminum since 2002. He installs on doors, windows, and kitchen, etc… JamA. is speciA. in his work because he is known for his good work and quality of work. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This van allows him to transport his merchandise to his clients. JamA. has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

When JamA. first started his business, he passed through some financiA. issues in order to purchase the required tools. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, and he had experience in aluminum installation. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: to do some maintenance work on his van

loans.name: Anoch

texts.en:
Anoch is a 70-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Anoch has been selling coats and jackets since 1985. She is special in her work because she has good sales skills. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business since it is the winter season.

Anoch has been a micro-credit client for eight years now and has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work by diversifying her merchandise and by expanding her stock.

When Anoch first started her business, she passed through some financial difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to be financially independent. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has owned a bakery since 1990. He makes 'mankoucheh'. A 'mankoucheh' looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty 'mankoucheh'. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery and also pay his children's school tuition. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties since his was the only bakery in his neighborhood. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he had always wanted to open a bakery and have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 39-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hassan has owned a general store since 1999. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, home cleaning products, etc. Hassan is special in his work because he offers competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time.

When Hassan first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, as well as because of his prior experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Haisam

texts.en:
Haisam is a 22-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

Haisam has owned a hairdressing salon for almost two years now. He also does makeup, tattoos and hair removal, and sells beauty products. He is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and his clients feel comfortable going to his salon since he offers a lot of services. But most importantly, he is good in his work and is aware of the new hairstyle fashions.

When Haisam first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties, especially since he already had faithful customers from his previous job. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists.

Haisam has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and to make some décor changes. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and make some décor changes

loans.name: Harotione

texts.en:
Harotione is a 41-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

Harotione has been working as a heater repairer since 2006. He is special in his work because he does it well. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition and had some financial issues in purchasing the required tools for his work. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as the fact that he learned it since he was young. His clients can be anyone.

Harotione requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and pay his house rent. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase the required tools for his work and to pay his house rent

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Hayat has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. She has owned a toy store since 1995, and when she first started her business, she wasn’t able to offer a big quantity of toys. Thanks to her previous loans, she has been able to diversify her merchandise, expand her stock,, and improve her shop sales. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. Hayat is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new merchandise for her store and plans to continue improving her enterprise to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin, a 42-year-old man who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with his wife and their four children, has owned a grocery store for almost two years, a business he decided upon because he wanted to work independently. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, eggs, bread, etc.  Amin is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients, who are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan, his first, from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store.  When Amin first started his business, he successfully confronted both financial issues and competition, and in the future, he plans to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Ikram has owned a mobile phone business since 1996. She sells all types of new and used mobile phones and she also repairs phones. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a computer for her work. This is the first time that Ikram has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Ikram decided to start this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, and she's had no difficulties with it. In the future, she plans to increase her business by opening another mobile shop.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her work.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 28-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mazen has been working as an electrician since 2004. His clients are his friends and neighbors. This is the first time that Mazen has requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua.

He requested the loan to start and open a new business which will be selling mobile phones. This new business will allow him to increase his income. He plans to keep on working as an electrician, and to continue to improve his business.

loans.use: To start and open a new business

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en:
Yassine is a 54-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their six children. Yassine has owned a grocery store since 2006. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, eggs, bread and so on. He also sells some toys. Yassine is exceptional in his work because he knows how to treat his clients, who are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Yassine decided to open his store because he likes working as a trader, and when he first started his business, he had no problems. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 41-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hussein has owned a men's clothing shop since 2006. He decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and he likes trading. He sells jogging clothes, shirts, t-shirts, pants and men's accessories. Hussein is good at his work because he knows how to treat his customers, and knows how to advise them. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase the new winter collection for his shop. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

When Hussein first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to increase his inventory. This loan will help him to diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. In the future, he plans to build up his business.

loans.use: To purchase the new winter collection for his shop.

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: “Copacabana” es un grupo de 10 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Santiago II”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza, cereales, tostado de arveja, venta de carne, jugos y artesanía en joyas. Ellas están concientes de que tienen varias competidores y tienen que ser mejores que ellos, atendiendo a las clientas de la mejor manera y ofreciendo productos de calidad. Todas comparten un rico plato ya que les gusta confraternizar y sentirse en familia.
texts.en:
Copacabana is a group of ten women who attend their meetings at the Santiago II community center. They got together out of the necessity to access a loan. All of them need to increase their working capital. They sell beauty products, cereals, roasted peas, meat, juice, and jeweled handicrafts. They know that they have various competitors, and that they have to be better than their competition by giving their customers the best service and offering quality products. They all share a delicious dish because they like to socialize and feel like they are a family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Khouder

texts.en:
Khouder is a 53-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Khouder sells paintings and their frames. You can even bring him a painting and he will put it in a frame. He also repairs and cleans frames. Khouder does excellent work because he knows his craft. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and because he used to paint when he was younger. 

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new frames for his shop and to purchase a car for his wife. This is the first time that Khouder has requested a loan. This loan will help him to diversify his merchandise. In the future, he plans to open an exhibition room.

loans.use: To purchase new frames for his shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. sells charcoal in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Rose is 37 years old and is married to a teacher. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Serious Group

texts.en:
Johnson G. is the leader of a group of four borrowers called Serious. He is married and has three children between the ages of one and six. The youngest are in kindergarten. Johnson himself completed only 8th grade because he lacked financial support. He lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong County, Liberia.

His business is the production and sales of vegetables. He grows vegetables to be sold retail to residents of his community. Johnson has been running this business for two years and would like to improve his farm.

He needs this loan to purchase materials needed to expand production.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand production.

loans.name: Maurice Omondi

texts.en:
Maurice is married to Emmah, and they have two children, Nicole and Calele, who are 9 and 6 years old, respectively.

Maurice was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and he has no previous credit history. He intends to use this loan as working capital for his leather shoes manufacturing business. Maurice has been in the production of leather shoes for two years. 

His business is located within a parastatal institution (a government-run institution that provides services to the general population). He sells the shoes both locally and internationally. 

With the extra profits Maurice will invest in better machinery, as he hopes to own a factory in the near future. He believes that this will improve the living standards of his family and help his two children have a quality education. Maurice describes himself as a man who is very articulate.

loans.use: Working capital for his leather shoes manufacturing business

loans.name: Rosas De Viacha Group

texts.es:
Victoria T.  de 35 años vende papa y chuño (papa deshidratada) negocio que aprendió de su madre y que le ha permitido generar ingresos para sustentar a su familia, Victoria compra su mercadería de los diferentes pueblos ubicados en el Altiplano y los vende en la feria 16 de Julio los días jueves y domingo, también vende en la feria extranca de Rio Seco los días viernes y martes. Las compañeras de Victoria tienen sus propias actividades económicas como la venta de mochillas, ropa, confección de prendas de vestir y atención de tienda de barrio.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, materia prima y en algún caso activo fijo.
texts.en:
Victoria T. is 35 years old. She sells potatoes and chuño (dehydrated potatoes), a business that she learned form her mother and that has helped her bring in income to sustain her family. Victoria buys her merchandise from different towns in the Altiplano and she sells them in the 16 de July market on Thursdays and Sundays. She also sells in the Rio Seco market on Fridays and Tuesdays. Victoria's fellow lending group members have their own economic activities, such as selling backpacks, clothes, tailoring and tending to their own neighborhood stores.

They all need the loan to acquire merchandise, primary materials and fixed assets.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, primary materials and fixed assets

loans.name: Know Yourself Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Know Yourself. She is 48 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 28 and 31. Among them, they have completed educational levels from tenth grade through high school. Jacqueline is a fifth grade dropout due to lack of financial support. She also cares for two siblings.

She lives and works in the Old road/Gaye town community, south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. Jacqueline's business is the sales of general goods. She buys goods wholesale and sells at retail prices to residents of her community in Monrovia. She sells in a good environment in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Jacqueline has been running this business for ten years, and hopes to improve and expand her business. She needs this loan to move from a smaller table to a bigger table. She dreams of giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and is married with three children aged 10, 12 and 14. She lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Mary owns a shop from which sells in quantity different kinds of foodstuff such as rice, sugar, maize flour, beans, and so on. She has been selling these products for ten years and employs three people from her community. She earns a monthly profit of 250,000 RWF (approximately $US440). The hours of her business require that she work from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Mary is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business. She will purchase more rice, beans, sugar and so on which will help her to earn more profits.

With the profits she expects to earn, Mary will be able to pay school fees for her children, buy her own house, and save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, sugar, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 27 years old and is married with three children aged 2, 4 and 15. She lives in a region called Gatsata in the Gasabo district of Kigali Province, Rwanda.

Clementine owns a small shop that sells clothes. She has been in this business since 2006 and employs one person from her community. Before starting this business she was dependent on her husband but after becoming an entrepreneur she is able to contribute to her family since she earns 400,000 RWF per month (approximately 700 USD).

Clementine is requesting her first a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more clothes of various styles and colors. With this expansion she believes she will satisfy and attract more customers by offering them high quality clothes.

Through her business, Clementine hopes to earn more profits that will allow her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is a young hard working woman. She is a focused, hard worker. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Benedict is 38 years old, married and has four children.  Her children attend a government school. 

She has a poultry farm where she raises poultry birds to sell. She loves this business because it is highly competitive. Benedict is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more poultry birds and feeds. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds and feed

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia es una socia colaboradora y muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito D. Yarina Cocha, región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 51 años D. edad, es madre D. tres hijos(mayores D. edad) y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo.
Zonia se dedica a la venta D. chupetes y gaseosas, actividad que realiza desD. su casa.
Forma pate D. Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desD. hace tres años y el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en la venta D. frutas.
Actualmente necesita un crédito D. 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà insumos y productos para la elaboración D. chupetes. 
La meta D. Sonia es tener un quiosco para vender golosinas y chupetes.
texts.en:
Zonia is a participating member who is very hard working. She lives in Yarina Cocha District, in the Ucayli Region. She is 51 years of age, the mother of three grown children and she has the support of her husband. Zonia works selling suckers and carbonated drinks which she does out of her home. For the last three years she has belonged to the Las Fresitas (Little Strawberries) Communal Bank. The first loan of 300 New Sols which she received allowed her to invest in the sale of fruit. Currently she needs a loan of 3,000 New Sols with which she will buy ingredients and products for making suckers. Zonia's goal is to have a kiosk to sell sweets and suckers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and products for making suckers.

loans.name: Abdoul

texts.en:
Abdoul is 38 years, married, and has 5 children aged between 5 and 12 years old.  He lives in Gasabo, not far from the center of Kigali.  Abdoul has been a proven entrepreneur selling a variety of goods in his retail general store located in his area of residence.  He employs two people from his community and the business working hours are from 6 AM to 9 PM every day except Sunday.

Abdoul’s general store is currently facing an increased demand of some products.  Therefore, he is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so as to expand his business through purchasing more products that are in high demand.  The products to be purchased include cosmetic goods, toilet soaps, toothpastes, cooking oil, and many others.  

Abdoul expects to satisfy the growing number of customers who demand his products a lot as well as earning more profits than before.  Abdoul will also increase his savings for future financial stability and continue taking good care of his wife and children.

loans.use: to increase store inventory

loans.name: Joke

texts.en:
Joke is the owner of Boluwatife canteen, where she sells cooked food and drinks. She purchases her foodstuffs from Agege market. She has been running this canteen for the past 16 years. According to her, the business is doing fine and she makes a lot of profit from the business.

Joke is a member of Royal Mother 2 Union. She needs a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and other items to make her food delicious and attract more customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Llerle

texts.es:
Llerle es una socia alegre y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es profesor.
Llerle se dedica a la repostería por lo que prepara tortas para todo tipo de ocasión. Integra el Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió le permitió invertir en materiales para la elaboraciòn de tortas.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà insumos y utensilios para su negocio. 
La meta de Llerle es tener una pastelerìa y salir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Llerle is a happy and dynamic partner that lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 38 years old, the mother of three children and counts on the support of of her husband who is an instructor. Llerle is a pastry maker who prepares cakes for all occasions. She integrated with the Community Bank “Madres Corajes” for the past year and the first loan that she received allowed her to invest en cake baking materials. Right now she needs a loan of S/800 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she will buy supplies and utensils for her business. Llerle’s goal is to have a pastry shop and move forward with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the credit to buy supplies and utensils in order to prepare cakes.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Rafael M. de 35 años tiene su movilidad con el cual trabaja, prestando servicio de transporte, pertenece a un sindicatoque tiene 15 rutas, específicamente trabaja en la ciudad de El Alto,  con el préstamo solicitado desea comprar las culatas para su movilidad ya que están en mal estado, él recuerda que antes era solamente chofer asalariado ahora con un esfuerzo se ha comprado su propia movilidad. Las demás integrantes  tienen sus propios negocios como el tejido de mantas, carpintería, venta de velas, confección de mochilas y taller de llantería. 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Rafael M. is 35 years old. He has a small vehicle which he hires out, also, he is part of transportation union with 15 routes in the city of El Alto. With this loan he would like to replace the broken cylinder heads in his car. He remembers when he was only a driver and needed to rent a car. Now, with a lot of work, he has bought his own car. The other group members have their own businesses such as weaving, carpentry, selling candles, backpack making and a tire-repair shop. They need loans for buying merchandise and prime materials.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 25 years, married with three children who are between 4 and 6 years old.  Jean Damascene lives in Gikongoro, a region of the southern province of Rwanda, which is approximately a 3-hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Jean Damascene has been in the business of selling different products in his general store for more than 5 years.  He employs 2 people from his community to assist in his daily activities.

Jean Damascene’s general store has successfully grown as a result of the previous loan, which he paid back in full and on time.  He is therefore requesting his second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more foodstuffs like beans, sorghum, etc.  With these products, Jean Damascene is expecting to satisfy the growing number of customers demanding them as well as making more profits than previously.  

Jean Damascene also hopes to save a portion of his profits earned for future reinvestment in the business, providing more food for the family and continuing to pay the school fees for his children

loans.use: for store inventory

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desD. hace 5 años atrás, del distrito  y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella  tiene 57 años D. edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 8 hijos (1 vive con ella y 7 tienen familia).
Marcelina se dedica a la venta D. carnes y paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. artesanìas. Nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar carne D. cordero, alpaca, porcino y res.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Marcelina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Tupac Amaru I” for the past 5 years, and is from the Yunguyo District and Province, located in the Puno Department. She is 57 years old, does not have any formal schooling, and is married with 8 children (1 lives with her, and 7 have their own families). Marcelina sells meat, and concurrently also sells handicrafts. She tells us that with her first loan of 300 PEN that she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN which will be used to purchase lamb, alpaca, pig, and cow meat. Her dream for the future is to improve her business. What she enjoys the most about her Communal Bank is saving and meetings with the other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pig, lamb, cow, and alpaca meat.

loans.name: Alicia Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios incompletos, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Alicia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes y paralelamente a la venta de comida. Nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrà comprar mercadería de abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Tacna, comprarse un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Alicia has been a member of the "Tupac Amaru I" communal bank for fourteen years, in the Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department. She is 23 years old, has an incomplete secondary education, is married, and has two children. Alicia buys and sells groceries and, similarly, sells food. She tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was S/. 300 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She requests a loan of S/. 3,000 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to buy grocery merchandise such as noodles, sugar, rice, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a house in Tacna, buy herself a car, and for her children to be professionals. What she most likes about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with its members.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of noodles, sugar, rice

loans.name: Licila

texts.es:
La señorita Licila es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Candelaria” desde hace 3 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene no tiene hijos. Cuenta con estudios superiores completos y se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos y relojes y paralelamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Lucila nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fuè de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar màs mercadería como relojes, radios, etc.
Su sueño para un futuro cercano es poder solicitar un mayor crédito y así dedicarse a otro negocio más.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Miss Licila is a partner in the Community Bank of “Virgen de la Candelari” for the last three years. She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao in the area of Puno. She is 31 years old, single and does not have any children. She has finished her high school studies and is dedicated to the buying and selling of appliances such as clocks, watches and radios etcetera all alongside of the sale of groceries. Licila tells us of her first loan requested of the Manuela Ramos Movement which was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase the capital of her business. She is requesting a loan of S/2000 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she would be able to buy more merchandise such as clocks and radios etc. Her dream for the near future is to be able to request a larger loan so she could dedicate herself to an additional business. What she likes most about the Community Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clocks/watches and radios.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene owns a hair dressing salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells drinks and hair materials like shampoo, hair extensions and cream to her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and salon materials to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She is married with three children. She is a focused, hard worker. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell and salon materials

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: Ifeanyi is 37 years old and he is married with three children. His children are excelling in school. He sells for long hours to enable him support his family. Ifeanyi has a motor spare parts stall where he sells motor spare parts to make a living in Delta state, Nigeria. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Margein Araceli

texts.es: La señora Margein Araceli, ella tiene 33 años de edad, junto a su esposo tienen 3 hijos a su cargo. Tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Cabe señalarse, ella dio inicio a este negocio debido a la necesidad de auto mantenerse económicamente, debido a la situación actual del país. Ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy independiente ya que es una joven capaz de lograr sus metas .El crédito será invertido en la compra de zapatos, camisas, pantalones, cosméticos por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña ya que ahorita tiene bastantes pedidos. Ella tiene un sueño de llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Margein Araceli is 33 years old. She and her husband have 3 children. For the past 7 years she has sold general merchandise. It is worth noting that she started in this business because of the need to take care of herself financially given the country's current situation. She has always liked being a very independent person and she is very capable of achieving her goals.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes, shirts, pants and cosmetics. Because the Christmas season is approaching, she has many orders right now. Her dream is to own her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Luna Radiante, que recientemente se formó para acceder al préstamo, esta integrada por 7 mujeres y 1 varón liderizadas por su mesa directiva desarrollan su reunión ordenadamente, así la  presidenta es María A., Tesorera es Maria Y.  y ocupando la cartera de Secretario de Actas está  Elisa T., indican que formaron el grupo por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo para mejorar sus niveles de ingreso, así todos tienen diferentes actividades económicas de producción, comercialización y servicios, esperan invertir el préstamo en sus negocios para hacer crecer el mismo.
texts.en:
La Asociación Comunal Luna Radiante meets at one of Pro Mujer Panamericana's Focal Centers. The group formed recently to gain access to credit. The group includes 7 women and 1 man. Led by their Executive Board, they carry out their meetings in an orderly fashion. The president is María A., the treasurer is Maria Y. and the secretary is Elisa T.. They indicate that they formed the group because they needed working capital to improve their income. They all have different economic activities in production, marketing and services. They hope to invest the loan in their businesses to make them grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and primary materials

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca is 30 years old. She sells planks and she is a very hard working woman. She is very happy with her plank business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with two children. Her children are excelling in school. Due to the increase in her customers, she hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  Her dream is to educate her children to the university level and also build her own house in the future. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Nappy Town Group

texts.en:
Jebbeh G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Nappy Town Group. She is a widow with four children between the ages of 9 and 19. Their educational levels range between 6th grade and university student. Jebbeh herself is an illiterate due to lack of financial support.

She lives and works in the Old Road Community, south of the capital city of Liberia, Monrovia. Jebbeh started in business with only 1,000 LRD, selling cooked food. Now, her business is the sales of food, such as rice, water, soft drinks and so on. She buys goods wholesale and sells at retail prices to residents of her community in Monrovia. Jebbeh has been running this business for five years, and hopes to upgrade to a restaurant. She always encourages customers to continue buying from her.

Jebbeh faces the problem of the lack of capital to expand her business. She needs this loan to improve her business.

Jebbeh dreams of giving her children a good education.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela sells stationaries and books in one of the biggest markets in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is married with four (4) children. She is 37 years old. Her children are excelling in school.With this business, she hopes to support her husband in meeting the basic needs of the family. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to  purchase more stationaries and books to sell.Angela is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationaries and books to sell

loans.name: Waterside  Youth Group

texts.en:
Thompson Q. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Waterside Youth. He is 52 years and is married with 6 children aged 15-31. The children's educational levels are from 2nd -6th grade and some are drop-outs. Thompson is a 10th grade drop-out due to poverty. He lives and sells on Randall and Water Street, Monrovia, Liberia.

Thompson's business is the sale of used shoes, which he buys wholesale and sells retail from a table on Water Street. He sells goods that attract customers to continue buying from him. Thompson has been running this business for 10 years, and hopes to expand his business and open a shop. He needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve business. Thompson dreams of sending his children to a better school and providing them with better health care.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née le 23 Novembre 1981. Emilienne vit depuis onze ans à Cadjèhoun, un quartier de la capitale économique du Bénin (Cotonou). Mariée à AGBOKOU ossè Edouard, un dessinateur, Emilienne est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Emilienne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Emilienne a arrêté les études au cours secondaire, et a appris la coiffure. C'est depuis 6 ans que Emilienne exerce cette profession. A côté de cela, Emilienne vend des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son salon de coiffure à cadjèhoun. C'est à Cadjèhoun et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Emilienne fait ses achats. Emilienne a obtenu antérieurement trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter son capital et d'élever le niveau de son activité, Emilienne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Emilienne was born on November 23, 1981. She has lived for eleven years in Cadjèhoun, a district in Benin's economic capital (Cotonou).  Married to AGBOKOU Ossè Edouard, a draftsman, she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  She lives together with her husband and children.  She comes to her husband's aid in covering family expenses. Emilienne halted her studies in secondary school and learned how to style hair.  She has been in this profession for six years.  Aside from this, she sells hair extensions, cosmetics, and phone recharge cards in her hair salon in Cadjèhoun.  She makes her purchases in Cadjèhoun and also at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She obtained three ALIDé loans before which she repaid.  With the aim of increasing her capital and raising her level of business, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of cosmetics, hair extensions, and phone cards

loans.name: Angela Del Pilar

texts.es: Ángela tiene 31 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 3 años ya anteriormente solo vendía productos de la Avon por lo que no tenía suficiente capital para ofrecer a sus clientes todos los productos necesarios ya que además sus clientes ya que le solicitaban encargos de ropa, por lo que tenia este empleo y tenía que buscar la manera de enfrentar este negocio. Para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que son lo más importante para ella. el sueño de Ángela es heredarle el negocio a sus hijos para que tenga un medio de superviencia.
texts.en:
Ángela is 31 years old. Her business is the sale of general merchandise. Three years ago, she sold only Avon products because she did not have enough capital to offer her clients all the products they needed. The clients wanted to order clothing, so she had to find a way to add that to her business.

The most important thing for Ángela is to help her three children get ahead. Her dream is to pass the business on to them, so they will have a means to survive.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Saturday is 49 years old, married and has six children.  He sells crates of drinks, wholesale and retail. He lives in Delta state, Nigeria.  His greatest joy in his business is having one-on-one interaction with his customers.  He hopes for a loan of N100,000, purchase more drinks to sell.  This is the high season for his business and he hopes to make more profits.  He says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina S. has two places where she sells her clothes, one in the market in Guatemala city, where she currently lives, and another in the market in Villa Nueva. She has been in the business of selling clothes for men for 35 years. She sells pants, t-shirts, handkerchiefs, socks, and dress shirts. She will invest the money from this loan in pants and shirts for her business. She is hoping that because Christmas is just around the corner, she will have the opportunity to sell more clothes and earn more money. She has previously had group loans with FAPE, and is now excited to be able to have her individual loan. Maria is 58 years old. She is married with seven kids, but all have grown up and no longer live with her. She is originally from Salcaja, Guatemala. She has been married to her husband for 25 years. She hopes to, in the future, be able to open another place where she can sell her clothes in Villa Nueva, and be able to, with the increased earnings, make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in pants and shirts for her business

loans.name: Evelyn Teresa

texts.en:
Evelyn Teresa S. T. is 27 years old and was born in Villa Nueva, Guatemala. She is married and has two children. Evelyn started helping her mother sell shoes and dresses. Five years ago, she started her own business selling clothing. Little by little, her earnings increased and her client base started expanding. Now, she has many clients, which she can attribute to the fact that she gives them a lot of attention. She is going to use this loan to invest in dresses, maternity clothes, and baby clothing.

Evelyn's business is located in Villa Nueva's market, where she sells dresses for fifteenth birthday celebrations, maternity clothing, and baby clothing. In addition to her business, her husband also helps provide for their family. With this loan, Evelyn hopes to increase her earnings and provide more for her family. Her dream is that her children receive a good education and use it to get a good job.

loans.use: to buy dresses, maternity clothes, and underwear

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadores Group

texts.en:

loans.use: Dish Soap, Tile Cleaner, Detergent

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: H. Jeanne est née le 27 Décembre 1956 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Jeanne vit depuis près de 20 ans au quartier Zogbohouè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FADEGNON Bob un retraité, Jeanne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Jeanne vient en aide à son mari dans l'entretien et l'éducation des enfants. Mais c'est surtout le mari de Jeanne qui assure les charges de la famille. Jeanne a arrêté les études au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite le métier de tisserand. Elle exerce cette activité depuis près de 20 ans. A côté de cela, Jeanne a commencé la vente de nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce de tomate et de poissons frits) à son domicile. Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est dans l'optique d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'élever le niveau de son activité que Jeanne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne H. was born on December 27, 1956 in Allada in the Atlantique department of Bénin. For 20 years, Jeanne has lived in Zogbohouè à Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Bob Fadegnon, a retiree, Jeanne is the mother of four children, all schooled. Jeanne lives together with her children and her husband. She helps her husband with the raising and education of the children, but it is primarily Jeanne's husband who is the head of the household. Jeanne stopped her studies in high school and soon learned the weaving trade. She has done this business for 20 years. In addition to this worke, Jeanne began to sell food (rice with tomato sauce and fried fish) at home. Jeanne stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She is an old client of ALIDé, having already benefited from 3 loans which she has repaid. She is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé with the intention of increasing her working capital and and her level of activity.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, weaving yarn and bags of rice

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio tiene 31 años, por lo que su trabajo empieza muy temprano por lo que tiene que buscar el alimento diario de su familia, el tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan de manera independiente y el menor de 16 años está a su cargo por lo que tiene la enfermedad de síndrome de Down por lo que él se encarga de su hijo. Su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, Rafael tiene muchos problemas pero no le impiden salir adelante el es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para proporcionarle mejora a su bote de pesca y comprar otros equipos. El deseo de él es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir trabajando furte para su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio, 31 years old, begins his workday very early as he must search for the daily food for his family. He has 3 children, of whom 2 are working and independent, and the third is in Rafael’s care because he has Down Syndrome.

Rafael has worked as a small-scale fisherman for over 5 years. He has many problems, but that doesn’t stop him from getting ahead, as he is a very hardworking and responsible man.

This loan is for working capital, and will be used for improvements to his fishing boat and to buy other equipment. Rafael’s desire is to better the conditions for his family, and to continue working hard for his family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improvements to boat and purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Namilyango Farmers' Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Margaret is 47 years old and married with 7 children aged 25 - 13, with the eldest having a certificate in education while the youngest is in Primary five.  Margaret also takes care of 2 orphans. Margaret has had a retail shop in Namilyango Kasenyi for 20 years and she is able to make some profit although the prices of basic items are expensive. She is good at her customer care skills and would like to expand her shop to have more goods for sale and to help educate her children so that they become better off. Margaret needs a loan to be able to buy more stock since this will boost her business, especially during the festive season where the consumption is very high. Margaret is really a hard working and friendly lady. 

(N. Margaret appears in the small photo, just like in the big photo and she is the leader of her lending group). If photo is much bigger, all faces are clear yet a bigger photo can not upload on the website.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Briggit

texts.en:
Sonia Briggit R. Guilluen has had a businesses of selling gifts, crystal glasses, and teddy bears.  She is hoping to expand her business with this loan and to be able to invest in new products that she will sell.  She wants to buy laundry detergent, rice, beans and oil to sell.

Sonia is forty-two years old.  She is a single mother with four children.  Her three oldest kids live outside of the house, but her youngest daughter still lives with her and is currently in school.  She hopes that this loan will be able to increase her sales, so that she can start some construction projects on her house and to so that her daughter can remain in school, and use her education in obtaining a future job.

loans.use: for store inventory

loans.name: Raquel Yamilet

texts.es: La señora Raquel Yamilet C. O. tiene 35 años, vive en el barrio Villa Venezuela es casada y su esposo labora en el área de la construcción en general, tienen 2 hijos que poseen las edades de 15 y 17 años de edad, ambos estudian la escuela secundaria. Ella ha trabajado fuertemente para poder brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor, tiene un pequeño negocio desde hace 4 años, el cual lo formo con la ayuda de su marido “Óptica Ambulante DAYLOP”. El mayor problema que esto le ha presentado ha sido, que el mercado se encuentra saturado de ofertas de este rubro y por tanto habría que tener un mayor y mejor inventario de productos, para poder subsistir, es por esta misma razón que decidió solicitar este préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y así poder ofrecer una amplia gama de productos, agradecería el apoyo que pudieran brindarle pues lograrían una mejor evolución en su negocio que esto a un largo plazo le brindaría los recursos económicos para aportar a la economía del hogar y de esta manera poder preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos a que sean ciudadanos de bien.
texts.en:
Raquel Yamilet C. O. is 35 years old and lives in the Villa Venezuela district. She is married and her husband is a construction worker. They have two children, who are 15 and 17 years old and are both attending secondary school. She has worked hard to be able to offer her children a better future and four years ago, with the help of her husband, she has started an optical business, the "Óptica Ambulante DAYLOP". The main problem she faces in this activity is that the market is very competitive, so that it is necessary to have more and better products to offer in order to stay in business. For this reason she decided to request a loan to invest in her business and so to be able to offer a large variety of products. She is very grateful for this opportunity that can help her to improve her business and in the long term to increase the financial possibilities of her family and, consequently, to help her children to receive a good education and to have good living standards.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to enlarge products' offer

loans.name: Kame Vendors Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Nuru is 30 years old and married with 4 children aged 12 – 2 years. She also helps to take care of some orphans including paying their school fees and general welfare. She is a business lady involved in selling produce and her business is mostly affected by the changing seasons and price fluctuations. She is able to make 140,000 Ugandan shillings (about $21 US) as profits a week, which help in restocking her business and paying her children’s school fees. She hopes to have a variety of produce in her stall as well as build her own house for a better life. She needs a loan to help boost her produce business with more foods for the season. 

(In the small photo is Nuru N. who was interviewed and she is a part of the group).

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Domingo Rolando

texts.es: Domingo Rolando es un hombre trabajador, su actividad económica es una miscelánea, hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que el inicio con muy poco capital pues no tenía los suficientes recursos, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado mejorar sus productos y así ha mejorado cada día, junto a su esposa han  mejorado la administración de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para ropa en general, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, calzado y lo más importante granos básicos ya que en temporada navideña recibe muchos pedidos. Sus deseos son de ampliar con mucho más productos.
texts.en:
Domingo Rolando is a hard-working man. He has been selling sundries for over 14 years. He started this business with very little capital because he did not have sufficient resources. With the help of loans, he has been able to improve his products. That is how he has improved every day; he and his wife have improved the administration of the business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy general clothing, sweets, refreshments, soft drinks, footwear, and most importantly, basic grains. He receives lots of orders during the Christmas seasons. His wish is to expand with many more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bolívar

texts.es: El señor Bolívar D. R. tiene 44 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, él con su esposa tienen 2 hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 16 y 14 años de edad, los dos estudian la escuela secundaria, los planes para el futuro son, el terminar la construcción de su casa para que de esta forma puedan tener un espacio más cómodo y seguro puesto que en el lugar donde habitan corren con mucha delincuencia, es por esta razón que decidieron solicitar este préstamo para poder construir un muro en frente de su vivienda que les brinde mayor  seguridad para todos, debido a que se encuentran en una etapa en la que la delincuencia se disfraza para envolver a los jóvenes a esa vida ociosa y peligrosa. Ellos esperan se les brinde el apoyo y  de esta forma poco a poco edificar su hogar en un ambiente sano, cómodo y sobre todo con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Bolívar D. R. is 44. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood with his wife and their two children. The children are 16 and 14, and they both go to high school. Their plan for the future is to finish construction on their house in order to be able to have a space that is more comfortable and safe. The place where they live has a lot of delinquency. That is why they decided to ask for a loan to be able to build a wall in front of their house. This will give them all greater security. They find themselves in a period where delinquency is disguised in order to involve young people in a pointless and dangerous life. They hope that you will help them to little by little build their home into a healthy, comfortable, and above all, safer environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in front of his house

loans.name: Javier Arnoldo

texts.es: Javier es padre de familia, tiene un hijo de 14 meses, el señor realiza una actividad comercial de servicio de moto taxi, tiene 2 años de trabajar en este negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante el y su familia, por lo que busca la manera de cómo ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia de una manera decente. El está muy contento con este negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que siempre se preocupa por mejorar cada en el servicio de su negocio. el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo como es proporcionarle mejoras a sus moto taxi, y reparar ciertas cosas como llantas, asientos entre otras cosas. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio.
texts.en:
Javier has a 14 month old son. His business is a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He has had this business for two years. Thanks to his effort, he has been able to get his family ahead. He looked for the way to earn a living and support his family in a decent manner. He is very happy with this business, which is his principal source of income. He is always concerned about improving every aspect of his business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to make improvements on his moto taxi and to make repairs on certain things like tires, seats, and other things. His wish is to get ahead with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ngandu Kigombya Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Immaculate is 33 years old and single with 2 children with the eldest in senior four vacation. She has a retail shop in Ngandu that she has been running for 6 years and her major challenge at the moment are the defaulters that do not pay for the goods taken or even those that make very late payments. 

She is able to make 105,000 Ugandan shillings (about $54 US) as profits a week. She hopes to make more money to be able to build a house for her children and stop renting. She also works very hard to ensure that her children’s school fees do not become a problem since she does not have anyone else to turn to apart from her loans. Immaculate needs a loan to be able to restock her business with more goods.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Ismelda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ismelda, es madre soltera con 2 hijos los cuales asisten al colegio, posee un negocio de venta de comida de lunes a sábado en su casa de habitación todos los alimento que ella vende son derivados del cerdo, realiza sus compras de contado y las ventas son de contado y al crédito, comenzó a realizar esta actividad para darle un mayor beneficio a su familia por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos y la de sus 2 hijos. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de cerdos, ingredientes y otras cosas que son necesarias para su elaboración. Su deseo es mejorar cada día en la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ismelda is the single mother of two children who go to school. She has a business of selling food from Monday to Saturday in her house. All of the food she sells is derived from pork. She makes her purchases for cash. Her sales are for cash and credit. She started this activity to help her family more. She is always looking for a way to improve her income and help her two children. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy pork, ingredients, and other necessary things for her cooking. Her wish is to everyday improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Stanley Gonzalo

texts.es:
Stalyn S. de 37 años, tiene una casa de ladrillos con algunos servicios básicos esta ubicada en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, el empezó desde niño cuando su padre comenzó en el negocio de hacer pan hace 30 años a tras y con esto obtuvo experiencia para poder ya hace 4 años tener su propia panificadora en su domicilio. 

Cuando ya comienza a caer la noche deja preparada la maza para la elaboración del pan y poder levantarse a las 5am para ponerla al horno y comenzar la venta a las 5:30Am, también vende leche, café y cocoa para el desayuno de las personas de su sector.

Uno de los problemas que tiene para poder hacer pan es con una de las maquinas porque la energía no es estable en el sector donde vive, su esposa le ayuda con algunos de los gastos de la casa trabajando en un bazar de venta de productos, ya que tienen 6 hijos uno ya mayor de edad que le ayuda y los 5 menores todavía están en una escuela fiscal cercana a su domicilio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más sacos de harina, huevos, azúcar para así poder tener la mas grande panificadora de su sector, y en el futuro quiere poder enseñar y dar trabajo a los jóvenes de su sector para que aprendan a hacer pan y así ellos salgan adelante como el lo hizo también de muy temprana edad.
texts.en:
Stalyn S. is 37 years old. He lives in a brick house with basic services located in the Paraíso de Guayaquil area. When he was young, his father began a business making breads. This was 30 years ago, and it gave him the experience so that, 4 years ago, he could start his own bakery in his home.

When the night falls, he leaves the dough preparation to make the loaves so that he can get up at 5am and put them in the oven, to begin sales at 5:30am. He also sells milk, coffee and cocoa for breakfasts to people in his neighborhood.

He has problems with one of his machines because the energy isn’t stable in the area where he lives. His wife helps with the household costs, working in sales in a store. They have 6 children, one who is already grown that they support, and 5 who are still in a fiscal school close to their home.

With this loan, he wants to buy bags of flour, eggs, and sugar so that he can grow his neighborhood bakery. In the future, he hopes to teach and give jobs to the youth in his neighborhood so that they can learn to make bread and get ahead at a young age, as he did.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of flour, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Melania Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Melania desde hace varios años tiene un cafetín el cual logro poner con ahorros y dinero que prestaba en otros bancos, como madre soltera era mas difícil por que no tenia el apoyo moral ni económico lo cual fue una meta poder esforzarse cada día para apoyar  a sus hijos. Están ya mayores el cual uno de ellos trabaja y es casado y el otro es discapacitado por el cual aun cuida. Con sus crédito ha venido mejorando su casa como su negocio, con este quiere invertir en la compra de lácteos, jugos, gaseosas, diferentes bebidas ya que es lo que mas vende por gracias a Dios ha venido comprando diferentes productos para su negocio y desea surtirlo para dar un mejor servicio en gusto y preferencia de sus clientes. También comprara golosinas, repostería y otros. Contenta por el apoyo del financiamiento ya que ha logrado la inversión a corto plazo gracias al apoyo de Afodenic.
texts.en:
