Melania has had a cafeteria for several years that she was able to establish with savings and money loaned from other banks. As a single mother, it was very difficult since she had neither moral nor economic support. Her goal was to strive every day to support her children. They are grown now, and one works and is married. The other is disabled and still in her care. With loans, she has improved her home as well as her business. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of milk, juice, sodas, and different beverages because that is what she has sold the most, thanks to God. She has bought different products for her store and she wants to stock it to cater to the tastes and preferences of her customers. Also, she will buy candies, pastries, etc… She is content with the financial support that has allowed her to make short-term investments thanks to the support of Afrodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, juices, sodas, candies and sweets

loans.name: Kirabo Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Florence is a hard working and determined lady. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children aged 16 – 10 years, who are all in school. She has a retail shop in Bajjo; because of the lack of capital, she came to get loans, which are helping her very much. 

Every week for the last 2 years Florence has been making 50,000 Ugandan shillings (about $26 US) in profits.  She hopes for her shop to expand further as well as to educate her children to the highest level. She needs to buy more sugar, salt, bread, cakes, balloons and so much more for more sales. She is the leader of her group.

loans.use: for store inventory

loans.name: Umoja Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Margaret is 59, divorced, and has two children, aged 24 and 19, who are both at university.  She also takes care of other siblings and orphans. Margaret has had a retail shop in Kiwanga for 4 years and although she has debtors to her business, she is able to make 900,000 Ugandan shillings (about $46 US) as profits a month. 

She says that her supplementary sales help win more customers to her shop and she hopes to expand it further as well as have good health for her children. This is her second loan with her group and she would like to restock her business--especially now that it is a festive season and the consumption level is so high.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Juana Del Camen

texts.es: Juana Del Carmen tiene 50 años es madre soltera y como toda mujer emprendedora tiene que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio y con el paso del tiempo es que lo ha mejorado para beneficiar a sus clientes que siempre le solicitan productos de calidad y además les gusta el servicio que le ofrecen. Por lo que su jornada empieza desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene exhibir sus productos, arreglar la mercadería y limpiar el local. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para calzado, pantalones, shorts, camisas de vestir y vestidos por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña y quiero mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen is 50 years old. She is a single mother and, like all working mothers, must work to get ahead with her 2 children. Her job is in the sales of general merchandise, which she has worked in for more than 13 years. With time’s passing, she has improved to the benefit of her customers who always want quality products and also like the service that they are offered. Her days start very early, since she has to exhibit her products, arrange the merchandise and clean the shop. She enjoys her job, and for this reason is requesting a loan for working capital that will be designated for shoes, pants, shorts, shirts and dresses. Since it is the Christmas season, she would like to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Marling

texts.es: La señora Ana Marling  tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, que están estudiando. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo a pesar de no recibir una educación superior, ha luchado por salir adelante y por lograr que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar. Por lo que hasta los momentos ha mantenido su negocio pues le ha sido de muy buena para generar ingresos en su familia. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  12 años, debido a que quería brindar un mayor sustento a su familia. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de cerdos ya que actualmente tiene buenos pedidos. El sueño es comprar su propia casa ya que recientemente en donde vive esta alquilando.
texts.en:
Ana Marling, 33, is a single mother of three school-age children. She butchers pigs even though she wasn't trained in this. She has struggled to get ahead and to see that her children have the opportunity to go to school and this motivates her to continue with her work which has been profitable for her family. She began this work 12 years ago because she wanted to be a better provider for her family. The funds will be used to buy a larger amount of pigs because she currently has good orders to fill. Her dream is to have her own house since she's currently a renter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas, are part of the Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of 16 members from Andahuaylillas, a small town above the left bank of the Vilcanota River that is surrounded by mountains.

One member of the group, Luz Marina, is 39 years old. She lives with her spouse and two children. She was born in Andahuaylillas and still lives there today. Luz Marina has been selling meat and potato kabobs in the Andahuaylillas market for six years. She will use her loan from Arariwa to improve this business.

Most of the members of Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas are involved in food sales. Some, like Luz Marina, sell kabobs in markets, while others own small grocery stores or raise and sell animals. Leonardo has been raising hens for nine years. The group members will use their loans to improve their businesses in the food and animal sectors. 

All of the group members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to repay the monthly payments on time. 

(All of the group members were present in the meeting, but two do not appear in the video.)

loans.use: Supplies for food and animal businesses

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
SANTA ANA
Rosario es la presidenta del grupo,  vende ropa, zapatos, zapatillas, además de otros accesorios a pedidos hace varios años, aunque a veces no tiene mucha ganancia, aun así debe de aportar para algunos gastos en casa porque de lo contrario no les alcanzaría para sobrevivir.
Daysi es una de las socias más antiguas del grupo que se preocupa en el aporte puntual de la cuota,  ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de comida, menú durante el día y comida rápida como  salchipapas y hamburguesas por las noches, con los ingresos puede aportar y ayudar a su conyugue  con parte de los gastos familiares. 
Wilmer es el único hombre del grupo, se dedica al servicio de taxi hace 6 años, en este rubro tiene mucha experiencia, pero a veces tiene pocos clientes así que él, tiene que trabajar algunos días hasta altas horas de la noche para poder mantener a su familia. Algo favorable para el es que el auto es propio así que puede salir a hacer servicio en cualquier momento.
El préstamo solicitado por el grupo servirá para implementar sus negocios ya que en este mes de festividad, desean tener más ganancias que otros meses
texts.en:
SANTA ANA Rosario is the group leader; she has sold clothing, footwear and other accessories on order for several years. Although sometimes her profits are not very large she must still try to contribute to her household's expenses because otherwise they would not have enough to survive. Daysi is a long-standing member of the group who always sees to making punctual repayments. For the past 5 years she has sold prepared meals during the day and fast-food, like salchipapas (French fries with fried hot dog sausages) and hamburgers, at night. Her earnings help her spouse meet part of the family's living expenses. Wilmer is the only male in the group. He has been a taxi driver for 6 years. He has a lot of experience in this line of work but sometimes has few customers so he often has to work until very late at night to earn enough to support his family. One thing in his favor is that he owns his car so he can go out to work anytime. The funds requested will be used to capitalize their various work activities to take advantage of the festive times that are near for they hope to have better profits than in other months.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
SOL  NACIENTE
La socia María Elena es una mujer emprendedora y consciente de que solo trabajando puede salir adelante, hace varios años atravesó momentos difíciles en su vida ya que tuvieron que operarla tras una infección, después de su recuperación tuvo que seguir trabajando para poder mantener a sus pequeños hijos, así que comenzó a preparar desayunos en su casa y venderlos ambulatoriamente, eso solo le alcanza para cubrir parte de los gastos familiares. Así que con el préstamo recibido desea ampliar su negocio, y vender menú para poder obtener alguna ganancia extra, María Elena es la presidente del grupo.
Vilma es otra socia activa que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo hace 2 años, en ese tiempo pudo hacer un buen capital para comprar productos al contado y tener un stock de productos, para la satisfacción de sus clientes, ahora puede ayudar a su esposo con la economía en casa.
Al igual que María Elena, Gladys vende desayuno como ambulante, a veces no tiene muchos compradores, pero ella es optimista y sabe que hay mucha competencia, así que se levanta muy temprano pensando en el futuro de su hijo por el cual se esfuerza diariamente.
Los demás socios tienen diferentes negocios que aunque no les generan muchas ganancias, pueden aportar para algunos gastos, saben que la situación es cada día más difícil pero tienen como objetivo el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
SOL NACIENTE María Elena is an enterprising woman who is aware that it's only through hard work that she can get ahead. Several years ago she went through some difficult times. She needed surgery caused by an infection and, once recovered, had to continue working to be able to support her little children. She began preparing breakfasts at home which she would then go out to peddle. This only produced enough profits to partially cover her household expenses. So, with the funding she plans to enlarge her business preparing not just breakfasts but other meals as well to try to earn additional income. María Elena is the group leader. Vilma is another active member who has sold catalogue beauty products for the past 2 years. In that time, she was able to make enough profits to be able to pay cash for her products and have ample stock available for her customers. Now she is able to help her husband with household expenses. Like María Elena, Gladys peddles breakfasts. Sometimes she doesn't have many buyers but she is optimistic and knows that she has a lot of competition so, she rises very early thinking of her son's future, and makes her best effort each day. The other group members have their various lines of work that, although they don't generate huge earnings, do contribute a bit to cover family expenses. They know that each day the situation becomes more difficult but, still, they have their families' well-being as their objective.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en: Tetyana is married with three sons. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol town. Her monthly income is 3,000 Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH), which is about $375 US. Tetyana started this business 10 years ago. Being a hardworking and entrepreneurial person, she was able to develop her business well. She's got many repeat clients who often place orders. Tetyana would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to make additional income and fix her house.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Por Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es:
POR SIEMPRE AMIGAS
Flor tiene una bodega hace muchos años, sus ingresos solo le alcanza para mantener el negocio y no le permite costear los estudios D. su hijo que ya terminó la secundaria, ella nos comenta que con el préstamo recibido abrirá una pequeña librería con la ayuda D.  su mama, con el cual espera obtener mayores ingresos.
Por estas fiestas naviD.ñas Mercedes aprovechará en vender panetones, regalos, vinos y juguetes a todos sus vecinos, y espera juntar el suficiente capital para que el siguiente año pueda alquilar algún puesto en el mercado ya que en estos meses no le ha ido bien en su negocio. 
La secretaria Graciela venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo a pedidos,  en este negocio no tiene muchas ganancias, a veces solo alcanza para comer una vez al día ya que tiene que mantener a sus 6 hijos,  pero ella es muy optimista, menciona que los niños son su razón D. ser y el motor que la impulsa todos los días. 
Los socios están contentos con los préstamos ya que EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD les ha sido D. mucha ayuda ya que pueden comprar productos en mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
FRIENDS FOREVER Flor has had a grocery store for years . Her revenue is just enough to maintain her business and doesn't allow her to finance her son's education since he graduated from high school. She comments that with the recieved loan, she will open a small bookstore with her mother's help. She hopes to make greater profits with the bookstore. For the Christmas holidays Mercedes will take the opportunity to sell Christmas pastries, gifts, wines, and toys to all of her neighbors. With this she hopes to save up enough money so that next year she can rent a stand in the market since buisness has not been going well these past months. Secretary Graciela sells beauty prodcuts by catalog or orders. She does not make much profit with this buisness. At times she only has enough money to eat once a day since she has to raise her 6 children. In spite of all this she is optimistic and mentions that her children are the reason and the motivation that drive her everyday. The members are happy with the loans since EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD has helped them much by allowing them to buy wholesale and make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married with two children. She sells underwear as well as children's clothing at a small market in Mukachevo city and has been in this business for eleven years. Being very enthusiastic and optimistic she provides a good example to her neighbors, showing that economic crisis is not the end of the business. Georgina lives with her husband and children in a small house with big understanding and love towards one another.

Georgina would like to borrow 11,000 Ukrainian hryvnia to purchase more children's clothing to sell during coming Christmas season. Many people buy children clothing as a gift, so Georgina wants to have large assortment to attract even more clients.

loans.use: to expand store inventory

loans.name: Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo  "Orquídeas" esta representada por la señora Yovana y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrotes en tiendas en su barrio, elaboración y distribución D. pan, venta, venta D. productos naturales y venta D. productos D. nutricionales. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante con su experiencia y ganas D. salir adelante. El destino del crédito es para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en sus negocios con la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayudaran a generar mejores ganancias para el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias ya trabajaran bajo esta modalidad en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital en la cual van ingresando a su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. sacar adelante a sus negocios y a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Orquídeas" (Orchids) is led by Sra. Yovana and consists of 12 members who engage in different business activities in their neighborhood selling food, cosmetics, groceries, bread, natural products, and nutritional supplements. As in any commercial area, there always exists competition with both supply and demand, but the members know how to get ahead because of their experience and desire to succeed.

This loan will be used to diversify their products and invest in their businesses. They will purchase materials, supplies, and tools to help them generate more income for sustaining their families. The members are familiar with solidarity group loans since they have worked with other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are starting their third loan cycle together and have demonstrated responsibility and the desire to succeed in their businesses and in their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Miriam Lucia

texts.es:
Miriam P. de 34 años, de la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta ubicada en un lugar periurbano y tiene una casa de cemento con escasos servicios básicos, comenzó a estudiar corte desde sus 15 años, a los 18 años trabajo en un gabinete como estilista donde aprendió a administrar un gabinete de belleza, esto fue un empuje para que ella pusiera su propio negocio a la edad de los 24 años alquilando un pequeño local.

Miriam actualmente hace 20 cortes de cabello por día, los fines de semana hace tinturados y cepillados, inicia su jornada de trabajo desde las 9am hasta las 18pm, una de las complicaciones en el sector donde vive son los ladrones ya que en una ocasión se le llevaron las herramientas de belleza con que trabaja, aunque su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la familia como maestro conductor quiere asegurar el futuro de su única hija de 15 años que estudia en un Colegio Particular.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más secadoras, tintes, planchas de cabello, en el futuro Miriam quiere tener más productos de belleza de la mujer para tener más clientela y así aportar para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam P., 34, is from the Paraíso area of Guayaquil. She is located in a periurban (immediately adjoining an urban area; between the suburbs and the countryside) area and has a cement house with few basic services. She began to learn to style hair at the age of 15 and at the age of 18 began to work as a stylist where she learned how to run a beauty salon. This was her motivation to set up her own salon at age 24 by renting a small locale for it. Miriam currently does 20 hair cuts per day. On weekends she does hair coloring and straightening. She begins her work day at 9am and works until 6pm. One of the complications inherent in the area where she lives is the number of robberies. Already on one occasion she lost all her equipment and tools to them. Although her husband helps out with household expenses with his earnings as a conductor, she wants to insure her 15-year-old only daughter's, who is in private school, future. With the loan she will buy more hair dryers, hair coloring agents, hair straighteners. In the future, Miriam wants to have more beauty products for women so that she can attract more customers and thus provide more to insure her family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: El Pari Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "El Pari" están representado por la señora Beatriz y conformada por 14 miembros  que van ingresando a su tercer ciclo juntos demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos sin escatimar esfuerzos por sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios D. venta D.  comida, cosméticos, verduras, productos lácteos, ropa celulares, elaboración y venta D. pan y al transporte publico D. pasajeros.  En cuanto a la competencia siempre a existido en el mercado es por esta razón que la socias siempre están pendientes D. ella y D. lo productos mas competitivos para adquirirlos y poder generar una mejor ganancia para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería para la época naviD.ña que es cuando hay mayor demanda D. productos y cuando se pueD. generar mayores ganancias.  En cuanto a la experiencia las socias ya la tienen debido a que van ingresando a su tercer ciclo como grupo solidario y saben bien el manejo D. los fondos y asumir la responsabilidad D. cada inversión que realizan para seguir creciendo y fortaleciendo sus negocios para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “El Pari” are led by Sra. Beatriz. The group consists of 14 members who are starting their third loan cycle together. They have demonstrated honesty and responsibility with their payments. Without wasting any effort, the members strive to succeed in their small businesses selling food, cosmetics, vegetables, dairy products, clothing, mobile phones, bread, or transportation services. There is always competition in the market, so the members rely on one another to acquire products that will make them more competitive so that they can generate better earnings to support their families.

This loan will be used to acquire merchandise for the Christmas season when demand for products is higher and there is greater opportunity for generating better revenues. The members are already experienced since they are starting their third loan cycle as a solidarity group. They know how to manage their funds well and take responsibility for each of their investments, which will help grow and strengthen their businesses and proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Nuestra Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo "Nuestra Amistad" esta representada por la señora María Evelin y conformada por 11 miembros D. socias muy unidas y activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades crediticias para poder hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar cada día como lo demuestran en sus distintas actividades comerciales como la venta D. joyas D. plata como ambulante,  venta D. ropa, ropa americana (usada), comida (pensión),  además tienen negocios como la elaboración  y pintado D. manteles, elaboración D. cortinas y la repostería tradicional desarrollando sus  actividades en su propio domicilio y D. forma ambulantes. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores están presentes en su entorno, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia D. sus familias, en caso D. que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o por consiguiente diversifican su actividad económica D. forma que puedan generar un ingreso para el sustento D. sus hogares. El crédito  esta destinado para la compra D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas para una mejor realización D. sus trabajos con mayo eficiencia y con mayor agilidad para generar mejores ingresos. En cuanto a su experiencia ellas la tienen a pesar D. ser su primer ciclo gracias créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital a la cual agradecen por la confianza depositada y el apoyo económico brindado, que les otorga para poder hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar la vida D. los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Nuestra Amistad" group is led by María Evelin and maD. up of 11 members, who are very unified and active entrepreneurs, who want to get involved with credit transactions to help their businesses grow and to improve every day as their various commercial activities show. They are involved in such things as: peddling silver jewelry, selling clothing and used American clothing, sale of prepared meals. They also make and hand-paint tablecloths, make drapery, and bake traditional pastries. They work out of their own homes or as peddlers from place to place. They all have competition in their areas but they also have regular customers that they can count on to generate profits needed for their families' sustenance. When they aren't doing too well in a neighborhood they move on to others or they manage to diversify their activity so that they can continue to generate earnings for their homes. The funding will be used to buy ingredients, supplies and tools to improve their work with better efficiency and agility in order to generate better incomes. Despite this being their first loan with Agrocapital, they have previous experience in managing financing that they have had from similar institutions. They are grateful for the trust given them as well as for the economic help which allows them to see their business grow and their familis have better lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Niño Divino" esta representado por la señora Ana María y conformada por 12 miembros que se caracterizan por ser amigas, socias muy unidas y activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades crediticias para crecer y sacar adelante sus negocios de venta de comida, cosméticos, refrescos, pollo celulares y entre los varones se dedican al servicio mecánico, jardinería y el transporte.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus ventas están dentro del margen de ganancia necesario para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas para ayudar a realizar un mejor trabajo mucho más eficiente y capaz de competir en el mercado.  En cuanto a su experiencia ellas la tienen a pesar de ser su primer ciclo gracias créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital a la cual agradecen por la confianza depositada y el apoyo económico brindado, que les otorga para poder hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar la vida de los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Niño Divino" (Divine Child) is led by Sra. Ana María and consists of 12 members known for being close friends. They are active entrepreneurs who wish to pursue loans in order to grow and succeed in their businesses which include selling food, cosmetics, soft drinks, chicken, and mobile phones. The men of the group are involved in auto repair, gardening, and public transportation. Within such a competitive environment, we are able to mention that their sales are within the margin of profitability required to support their families.

This loan will be used to acquire merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them work more efficiently in their jobs and make them competitive in the marketplace. Despite this being their first loan cycle, the members have experience working with solidarity group loans through other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are grateful for the confidence and financial support provided to them. This will help the members grow their businesses and improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Jerónimo

texts.es:
Jerónimo J. C. es un señor de 31 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos  en una comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde hace tiempo don Jerónimo se  dedica a la siembra de piña, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo comenta que este proyecto  le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Jerónimo es un micro crédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Don Jerónimo es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jerónimo J. C. is a man of 31 years of age who lives with his wife and two small children in a community called La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. Alajuela's main areas of production are cattle farming and agriculture, in particular the cultivation of pineapple, which are predominantly commercialised for the international market. For this reason, the development of the community has grown in recent years, generating a higher demand for products and services and more job opportunities. Jerónimo has grown pineapple for many years, and so has a lot of experience in the care and maintenance of this type of cultivation. He says that this work has produced very good results at harvest time, which is why he wants to expand his plantation, as thanks to this business his family's quality of life has improved considerably. What Jerónimo is applying for now is a loan of ¢300,000 (three hundred thousand colones), to buy pineapple crowns to re-harvest and various supplies so that he can better support and maintain his crops and be rewarded with a very good harvest at the end. Jerónimo is a member of la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital (Trinchera de Pital´s Successful Women´s Community Business), one of 100 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, as well as actively participating in the organisation of loans in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to grow and maintain pineapple

loans.name: Las Preferidas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Preferidas" esta representado por la señora Mary y compuesta por 12 miembros los cuales han demostrado en las reuniones muchas ganas D. salir adelante muchas D. las socias se conocieron en sus actividades comerciales el mercado. En general las socias se dedican a la venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, venta D. pan y venta D. cosméticos por catálogos,  venta D. ropa y a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el ámbito laboral las socias tienen mucha experiencia trabajando en su rubro por lo que saben cuando el mercado donD. están genera o no buenos  ingresos caso contrario mueven sus puestos D. venta a ferias zonales o al interior del país. El destino del crédito es la adquisición D. nueva mercadería para la época naviD.ña así como para la compra D. insumos y materiales para realizar un trabajo mas eficiente por ejemplo las que son modistas comprara maquinas como surf hiladoras para cortar el tiempo D. entrega D. su mercadería.  Las socias van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos ya que del apoyo que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital depenD. mucho el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Las Preferidas” is represented by Sra. Mary and consists of 12 members who have demonstrated at their meetings their desire to succeed. Many of the members know each other though their business activities at the market. In general, the members are engaged in retail businesses selling groceries, bread, cosmetics by catalog, and clothing. Some members sew and produce garments. We are able to mention that competition exists in their area, but the members have extensive experience in their specific fields and know where they are able to generate the most revenue. This may require moving their vending posts to the district fairs or other places within the country.

This loan will be used to acquire new merchandise for the Christmas season, as well as supplies and materials to help them be more efficient in their work. For example, the seamstresses in the group will buy machines for spinning thread so that they can reduce the delivery time of their finished goods. The members are in their fourth loan cycle and demonstrated responsibility in completing their payments. They rely heavily on the assistance provided by Fundación Agrocapital in order to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina S. P. es una joven señora de 23 años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Ella  se dedica a la avicultura, específicamente a la cría de pollos para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad. 

Actualmente doña Carolina   está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de más pollos para engorde, así como compra de concentrado para su alimentación y productos para la prevención y  tratamiento de enfermedades, además de ampliar y reforzar su local. 

Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Doña Carolina es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Carolina S. P. is a young woman of 23 who lives with her husband in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, located in province of Alajuela. The principle commercial activities in the area are cattle raising and agriculture, especially pineapple. These products are sold on the international market. For this reason, the community has been growing in recent years, generating more demand for products and more opportunities for work.

Carolina’s business is poultry, specifically the raising and fattening of chickens. She sells her products to the neighbors in her community, and they are quite satisfied with their quality.

Carolina is seeking a loan of 300,000 colones to purchase more chickens, as well concentrate for their feeding, products for prevention and treatment of diseases, and to strengthen the pens. With this loan, she hopes her microbusiness will grow and be able to serve more clients and offer better products. All this will help Carolina improve her living conditions.

Carolina is a member of the “Empresa Communal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital,” one of the 100 organizations associated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it, she expects to continue growing personally and economically. She also wants to actively participate in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and supplies

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " 27 de Mayo " esta representado por la señora Mariza y conformada por 12 miembros muy alegres y solidarias, pero sobre todo muy trabajadoras como lo demuestran cada día yendo a trabajar de madrugada en sus puestos de venta de pollo, salteñas, cosméticos, comida, joyas, ropa y al servicio de amplificación y electricidad. Dentro del ámbito de venta de comida, ropa y productos de belleza existe mucha competencia por lo que las socias se ven obligadas a mover sus negocios a otros mercados. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ganancias e incrementar los ingresos para sus hogares. Este grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando tener capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados de forma honesta y puntual ya que de ello depende el crecimiento de sus negocios y por ende el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “27 de Mayo” (May 27th) is led by Sra. Mariza and consists of 12 cheerful and supportive members. All of them are hard workers as demonstrated each day when they open their vending stalls early to sell chicken, empanadas, cosmetics, food, jewelry, and clothing. Some members provide amplification and electrical services. In the retail sectors involving food, clothing, and beauty products, there is much competition, so the members are forced to keep their businesses moving to different markets.

This loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their earnings and increase their household incomes. The group is starting their second loan cycle. They have demonstrated the ability to manage their funds in an honest and timely manner because the growth of their businesses and the welfare of their families depends on their success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Socios Unidos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Socios Unidos” esta representado por la señora Guadalupe y conformada por 12 miembros muy responsables y con grandes expectativas D. seguir creciendo para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Cada una D. las socias tiene sus actividades comerciales como se la venta D. D. comida, carne, cosméticos, joyas, pan D. batalla y otros se dedican a la jardinería. Dentro del ámbito D. venta D. productos existe una elevada competencia ya que existe una gran gama D. productos, es por resta razón que las socias deben esforzarse más en sus ventas diarias ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El crédito será destinado a la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven a la realización D. un mejor trabajo capaz D. competir en el mercado. Los miembros D. este grupo se encuentran cursando su cuarto ciclo juntos demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos ya que D. ellos depenD. el sustento D. sus familias las cuales ya se han visto mejoradas en el transcurrir D. los ciclos que llevan juntos los socios.
texts.en:
The group “Socios Unidos” [United Partners] is represented by Ms. Guadalupe and formed from the twelve very responsible members with grand expectations of continued growth in order to give their families a better quality of life. Each of the partners has their commercial activities with the sale of food, meat , cosmetics, jewels, “battle bread” [crispy mini-loafs] and others are dedicated to the gardening. Within this product sales environment, there is a high level of experience and a wiD. variety of products, for this reason the partners push themselves more in their daily sales as their families’ sustenance depends on it. The loan is marked for the purchase of merchandise, primary materials and tools that help them to do the best job possible in order to be competitive on the market. The members of this group find themselves passing a quarter century together and have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in their payments, as they depend on these to sustain their families, who have seen improvements in the passing of time that they have been together as partners.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Siempre Amigas" esta representada por la señora Maria Kelly y conformada por 14 miembros que ya van ingresando a un segundo ciclo demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos así como capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados. Cada una de las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, arroz, joyas y al servicio de peluquería, carpintería y lavandería. Las socias están concientes que lo que realmente hace la diferenta entre un negocio y otro es el trato que se brinda a los clientes para que se hagan fieles a los productos ofrecidos por las socias es por esto que no tienen mucha competencia en su mercado laboral. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas que les ayude a generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a su experiencia las socias tropezaron con algunas malas socias en el grupo anterior pero supieron salir adelante y cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos trabajando en equipo y de forma unida.
texts.en:
The "Siempre Amigas" ("Always Friends") group is represented by Maria Kelly and consists of 14 members who are entering their second loan cycle demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments as well as the ability to administer the funds. Each one of the members makes a living in different commercial activities, such as selling food, cosmetics, groceries at neighborhood stores, rice, jewelry, as well as offering hair-cutting, carpentry and laundry services. The members are aware that what really separates one business from another is its treatment of its customers, and it's for this reason they don't have too much competition. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise, ingredients and tools that will help the members generate more income to be able to give their families a better quality of life. In regards to their loan experience, the group ran into some bad members in a previous group, but they have kept moving forward and have been timely with their payments working together as a team.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Gaviotas" esta representado por la señora Viviana y conformado por 12 miembros que van cursando su tercer ciclo con optimismo y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Dentro del grupo existen socias que se dedican a la venta e productos como comida, cosméticos, ropa de cama, ropa de niños y otras se dedican al servicio domiciliario.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo siempre esta presente pero las socias se esfuerzan por salir adelante en sus pequeños negocios saliendo mas temprano que el resto de las vendedoras comprando mercadería de la época u ofreciendo productos diferentes a los que han en el mercado. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para el sustento de sus familias y para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que son su razón para trabajar. Dentro las expectativas que tienen cada miembro del grupo esta el de poder sacar adelante sus negocios con mayor mercadería y mejorando sus ingresos cada día mas para poder vivir mejor.
texts.en:
The Seagull group is represented by Sra. Viviana and made up of 12 members who are in their third cycle with optimism and responsibility for their payments. Within the group there are members who are dedicated to the sale of products such as food, cosmetics, bedding, kid's clothing and others that are dedicated to work in the home. Although the competitive environment is always present, the members make an effort to succeed in their small businesses, starting earlier than the rest of the vendors buying merchandise during that time, or offering products that are different than those that are present in the market. The destiny of the funding is for acquisition of additional merchandise, inputs, and tools that will help them generate more business to sustain their families and give their children a better quality of life, since they are the reason that they are working. In the expectations of each member of the group is to be able to succeed in their businesses with better merchandise and increase profits every day to be able to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Banquito Nueva Alianza Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “BANQUITO NUEVA ALIANZA”

Delia es una socia de la alcancía comunal “Banquito Nueva Alianza” llamada así no solo porque sus miembros viven en la misma zona, sino también porque buscan conocerse mejor, dar oportunidades y compartir experiencia. “Desde pequeño he enseñado a mis hijos a esforzarse, ya que si algo llega fácil, entonces fácil también se va”.

Apenas Delia acabó el colegio, empezó a ayudar a su tío en el aparado de calzado, fue ahí donde aprendió el oficio del aparado y reparación de calzado, pero era algo que a su corta edad, le parecía muy cansado, entonces decidió ayudar a una señora, amiga de la familia, en la venta de productos de belleza, cosméticos de marcas conocidas, pasaron los años Delia ya con una pareja estable decidieron tener hijos, fue así que Delia se convirtió en madre de dos hijos, entonces Delia tomo la decisión de independizarse, fue así que se inscribió para ser vendedora de productos de belleza ahora ya tiene 10 años dedicada a ese negocio, y en la actualidad gracias al asesoramiento de su tío y con la ayuda de su pareja Delia abrió en su casa uno espacio para el aparado y reparación de calzado, ella se ha dedicado mucho a sus trabajos, y agradece que gracias a ellos ha podido darle la educación a sus hijos y arreglar su casa.
Con el nuevo préstamo Delia planea invertirlo en la compra de productos de belleza ya que es su negocio mas rentable.
Ella sueña con tener su hogar en completa armonía, estar más unida a su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Communal Bank “Banquito Nueva Alianza” (New Alliance Bank), which is so named not only because the members live in the same area, but also because they seek to know each other better, provide opportunities for one another, and share their experiences with each other. She says, “Since they were little, I’ve taught my children to try hard because if something becomes easy, then anything can be made easy also.”

As soon as she completed high school, Delia started helping her uncle in his shoe workshop, where she learned the trade of manufacturing and repairing shoes. However Delia grew tired of this work at her young age, so she decided to help a female friend of the family sell a well-known brand of beauty products. After a few years passed, Delia and her steady boyfriend decided to have children. She became a mother of two and then decided to become independent. Delia signed up to be a sales representative of beauty products and has been in this business now for 10 years. Thanks to the to the advice of her uncle and the help of her boyfriend, she opened a space in her house for manufacturing and repairing shoes. Delia dedicates most of her time to both of her businesses, which enabled her to provide for her children’s education and remodel her home.

With this new loan, Delia plans to purchase beauty products since this particular business is more profitable. She dreams of having a household in complete harmony so that her family becomes closer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Los Milagros Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Milagros” esta representado por el señor Ignacio Grover y conformado por 13 miembros  muy alegres y muy capaces, Una gran mayoría D. ellos se dedican a la venta D. comida como platos típicos y pato, el resto D. los socios se dedican a la venta D. bebidas, verduras, cosméticos, dulces y al servicio D. enseñanza y costura D. prendas D. vestir. Son personas muy trabajadoras y amistosas por lo que no tienen mayor problema con la competencia ya que están seguros D. los platos que preparan ya que los comensales vienen D. todas partes D. la ciudad.  El destino del financiamiento es para la ampliación y remodelación D. sus locales así como para la compra D. vehículos para trabajar o para el reintegro D. un lote D. terreno para un local nuevo que ayudara a multiplicar sus ganancias y a mejorar su calidad D. vida. Los miembros del grupo van cursando un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución demostrando mucha puntualidad y esmero en su trabajo por lo que siempre tendrán la mano amiga D. Agrocapital para apoyarlos en sus proyectos. .
texts.en:
The group “Los Milagros” ("The Miracles") is represented by Ignacio Grover and maD. up of 13 very cheerful and capable members. A great majority of them work selling food, such as duck and traditional dishes; the rest of the members sell soft drinks, vegetables, cosmetics or sweets, or they proviD. services such as teaching or tailoring. They are very hard-working and friendly people who do not have significant problems with competition, since they are confident about the dishes they prepare, and their peers come from all parts of the city. The aim of the current loan is to expand and remodel their shops, purchase vehicles for their businesses, and rehabilitate an empty lot for a new shop, which will help them to multiply their profits and improve their quality of life. The members of the group are going through another cycle within the institution, demonstrating great punctuality and diligence in their work, so that they will always have the helping hand of Agrocapital to support them in their projects.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Siempre Unidas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Siempre Unidas" esta representada por la señora Reinalda y conformada por 14 miembros que ya van ingresando a un tercer ciclo demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos así como capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados. Cada una D. las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, computadoras, Tarjetas y al servicio D. albañilería. Las socias están concientes que lo que realmente hace la diferenta entre un negocio y otro es el trato que se brinda a los clientes para que se hagan fieles a los productos ofrecidos por las socias es por esto que no tienen mucha competencia en su M. laboral. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que les ayuD. a generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a su experiencia las socias tropezaron con algunas malas socias en el grupo anterior pero supieron salir adelante y cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos trabajando en equipo y D. forma unida, mejorando cada día mas su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The "Siempre Unidas" group, led by Reinalda, is maD. up of 14 members who are starting their third cycle having demonstrated honesty and responsiblility in their repayments as well as capacity to administer the funds received. The members are in different lines of commerce such as, sale of prepared meals, cosmetics, grocery stores, computer services, phone cards, and masonry. They are conscious that what makes the difference between one group and another is the care one gives to customers so that they will become return customers and faithful to the products offered by the members. This is why they don't have much competition. The new financing will be used to buy merchandise, raw materials and tools that will help them generate better earnings in order to proviD. their families with better living conditions. As for their credit history, they ran into some underperforming members in their previous group but they managed to forge ahead anyway and make their repayments in a timely fashion working as a cohesive unit and daily improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina S., tiene 40 años, vive en  el Barrio de la  Francia, es casada y su esposo es Contador Público y ayuda con los gastos de la casa, ellos tiene 4 hijos entre las edades de 23, 18, 13 y 4 años, la hija mayor es casada y los otros hijos actualmente se encuentran estudiando, ellos se dedican al cultivo de piña, siendo este su mayor ingreso, tienen 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y uno de los problemas a los cuales le han hecho frente, ha sido la escases de agua potable, debido a la zona donde habitan, no les llega el agua con frecuencia, ellos planifican que estarían diversificando sus cultivos con la ayuda de este préstamo, pues lo desean para poder comprar fertilizantes y poder darle mejor mantenimiento al cultivo, que a largo plazo significaría la multiplicidad de los cultivos y un mayor ingreso económico que ayudaría en gran medida a la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Argentina S. is 40 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of La Francia. Her husband is a Certified Public Accountant and helps with the household expenses. They have four children ages 23, 18, 13, and 4. The oldest daughter is married and the other children currently attend school.

Rosa grows pineapple as her main source of income and has 16 years of experience in this activity. One of the problems she faces is the lack of potable water since it does not reach her area very often. Rosa plans to diversify her crops with the help of this loan. She wants to buy fertilizers so that she can improve the maintenance of her crops. In the long term, she would like to raise a variety of crops so that she can increase her income and improve her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Thelma Margarita

texts.es: La señora Thelma Margarita,  tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y sus hijos están ya mayores y dos son menores de edad. La señora Thelma tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, además que también los fines de semana elabora venta de comida en su negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 16 años, el cual lo inicio para buscar fuentes alternativas de ingresos, debido a que había quedado desempleada. Con una buena administración le ha ido bien en su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de inventarios, principalmente desea invertir en compra de granos básicos, que son los que más busca la gente en su venta. Su sueño en el futuro siempre ha sido llegar a tener un mini súper, ya que vive en un barrio con bastante demanda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thelma Margarita is a 46-year-old single mother with 2 young children. She has a store located in her home. Additionally, on weekends she also sells food in her business. She started up this business 16 years ago to search for an alternative source of income after becoming unemployed. With good management, things have gone very well for her in her business. This credit will be invested in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise, principally basic grains, which people look for most often in her store. Her future dream has always been to have a small supermarket, since she lives in a neighborhood with a pretty large demand for basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her store

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe J. O. has a business selling clothes for men and women, selling lotions, as well as selling canned food products, such as tuna.  She started her business of selling clothes two years ago.

Guadalupe is 67 years old.  She is married, and has three kids that are already grown up.  Although she was born in Chinautla, Guatemala, she now lives in her house in Villa Lobos.

This is Guadalupe's third loan with FAPE on Kiva, and is happy to be able to continuing growing.  She hopes that Christmas time sales will help her grow even more.  She hopes to use this extra income to support and help her family.

loans.use: toys, clothes, and canned food to sell

loans.name: Magaly Salvadora

texts.en:
Magaly has a general grocery store in Villa Nueva's market. She has had this store for quite some time now. Among the most popular items that she sells are eggs and sweet candies. She will use her loan to invest in more of these items.

Magaly has four kids who are already grown up. Her husband works in construction, and helps to cover the costs of the house, but he doesn't earn much and he can't quite cover all the necessities. They have their own house, but they would like to use the increased earnings from the loan to continue construction projects around the house.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, candy, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Roman Andres

texts.es: EL SR. ROMAN ES MECANICO DESDE HACE 23 AÑOS, EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE AHORA EL TIENE SU PROPIO TALLER, DONDE TRABAJA JUNTO A 2 AYUDANTES, SU ESPOSA ES COMERCIANTE Y TRABAJA VIAJANDO AL INTERIOR DEL PAÍS TIENE 3 HIJOS EL SEÑOR TIENE MUCHO REQUERIMIENTO POR SU CALIDAD EN EL TRABAJO Y SOBRE TODO POR EL COMPROMISO DE ENTREGA EN FECHA INDICADA. POR ESE SU COMPROMISO HAY DIAS EN LOS QUE SE QUEDA A TRABAJAR HASTA HORAS DE LA MADRUGADA. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN MOTOR A MEDIO USO.
texts.en:
Mr. Roman has been a mechanic for 23 years. He started as an assistant and now he has his own workshop, where he works along with 2 assistants. His wife is a merchant and works traveling throughout the country. They have 3 children. Mr. Roman is well known for his quality work and above all else, for finishing his work on the date promised. Because of this commitment, there are days on which he stays to work until late into the night. He wants to use the credit for the purchase of a used engine.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of an engine

loans.name: Raúl Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Raúl Alfredo R. G., tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la Comunidad Sandino, es casado su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y en el ramo de la belleza, aportando a la economía del hogar, El señor Raul es guardad e seguridad, ellos tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 15, 9 y 5 años de edad  los tres estudian, pero la mayor apoya con los quehaceres domésticos, para ellos el mayor deseo que poseen es el tener los recursos necesarios para poder preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos y hacerlo en un ambiente mas cómodo y seguro para toda su familia, pero para alcanzar este sueño han considerado solicitar un préstamo con la intención de realizar mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar, con el préstamo comenzaran una primera etapa de compra de materiales tales como , cemento, arena y cal para darles un repella fino a las paredes de su hogar, ellos desean se les brinde un  apoyo en este proceso de remodelación de su hogar en donde toda su familia habitaran de una manera más justa socialmente.
texts.en:
Raúl Alfredo R. G. is 45 years old and lives in Comunidad Sandino. He is married, and his wife works in the beauty industry selling cosmetics to support her husband with the family finances. Raul is a security guard. They have three children, ages 15, 9 and 5, all of whom are in school, and the oldest one helps out by doing some chores around the house. Their biggest wish is to have the necessary resources to be able to professionally educate their children and for the entire family to live in a more comfortable and safe environment. In order to reach this dream they have requested the loan with the intention of making improvements to their home's infrastructure. With the loan they will take the first step of purchasing materials such as cement, sand and lime to put a fine plaster on the walls of their home. They desire this support in helping them remodel their home so the entire family can live in a more socially just way.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make improvements on his home

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor T. is a 61 year old married woman who lives in the village of Prk Rosal, Brgy Balingasag, Bago City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, a pig fattening business, and a rice farm.

Eleanor’s husband, Efren, is an accounting clerk in one of the milling centrals in Negros. They have 5 children who are between 21 to 31 years old.  While the one child may have his own family already, the rest of Eleanor's children help out in the business. Eleanor joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store, pig fattening and a rice farm. Now, she earns an average monthly income of  PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Eleanor is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and rice farm, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, on her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing the amount of PHP19,500, which she intends to use for her general store. Eleanor is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital for general store and pig fattening businesses.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma B. is a 69 year old married woman who lives in Prk San Gabriel, Brgy Balingasag, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by managing a general store. Elma’s husband, Juanito, helps her run the business and they have 8 children and 14 grandchildren.  
Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by becoming involved in a general store and rice farm. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 11,250 from her business activities.
Elma is a  member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund her general store's operations and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, for her 17th cycle loan, Elma is borrowing the amount of  Php 19,500, which she intends to use for her general store and rice farm. Elma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a more comfortable life.
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon  word that means <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program,  NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path  that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> - a title of esteem  that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working inventory for general store

loans.name: Merlanie

texts.en:
A 51 year old mother who strives very hard to help improve the living condition of her family, engaging in a different kind of business where she can get an income for a living. Merlanie L. lives in the village of Hda. Bubog, Brgy. Bubog, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Pedro who works as a fisherman and sometimes helps his wife with her business. The couple is blessed with 4 children ages 13 to 34 years old. Some of their children help them with their business.

In the beginning, Pedro's income was just enough when the children were still small. But as time goes by she noticed that their household expenses were gradually increasing specially for the food and education of their children. She then helped her husband fish and peddle it in her community. But she wanted to put up her own business as an additional income for their family. 

In 2004, Merlanie's friend encouraged her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon as a group member so she can get a loan for the General Store. Upon joining, the business brought additional income to the family and helped with the education of their children. As her business continued, she was able to expand it because of her successive loans. As her loans continued, she was able to help her husband in putting another source of income catching crabs, and bale to buy fish net for fishing. From this business she was able to earn Php 8,000 per month. She saves most of her income for her children and for her family.

Her previous loan of Php 9,500 for her general store business was fully paid and she was able to access a bigger loan with the next cycle. At present, her 9th cycle loan in the amount of Php 12,000 will be used for the repair of her fishing boat, buy other fishing equipments and for her general store.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital and repair of fishing boat

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
A mother of 8 children ages from 14 to 34 years old who aims to see all her children finish a college degree and be able to help them rise from poverty. Elma L. would always advise her children about the good things that must done to achieve their dreams for their future. She is 53 years old and still striving hard to help her husband support the needs of their family. The live in the village of Brgy Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental. 

In order to earn and help her husband, Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have a capital to put up a new general store in the area adjacent to her house. She has experienced minimal problems like the lack of goods sold due to lack of capital and the income was too small that sometimes capital was used to defray expenses. However, Elma was able to turn the business around. As her loans continued, her business became a big help to her family because she earned a minimum of Php 7,000 every month. Portion of this income was used for an additional capital, save for the children's education and help in their household expenses.

Elma's previous loan of Php 13,000 was utilized as an additional working capital for the general store. The said loan from NWTF-PD was fully paid in full and on-time without any delay. Her present 8th cycle loan of Php 16,000 will be used in her general store and whatever income she earns from it will be used for her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means <u>Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
Merceditha S. lives in the village of Nabuswang, Brgy Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She is 65 years old but is still strong enough to manage her business. Her husband, Orlando, oversees their rice farm but cannot do it full-time because he previously suffered a stroke. The couple has seven adult children who also help them with their household needs. Merceditha wants her business to continue so they can have a comfortable way of living and save for their future.
To help her husband provide in preparation for their children's college education, Merceditha began a general store business. She started with a small store adjacent to her house and earned a small income, which was a big help in sustaining her family's needs, especially her children's. As time went on, she wanted to earn more by expanding their general store.
When Merceditha decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, she knew that the loan she got for her general store would help her tremendously in increasing her income. She was able to buy new products to sell and set up a coffee shop within her store. As her loans continued, she purchased and managed fishponds that helped her with her other needs. The successive loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon brought comfort to Merceditha's family for the help they were to her businesses, and she now earns 14,000 PHP a month.
Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP was paid in full and on time within her loan term. Now, Merceditha is borrowing 26,000 PHP as additional working capital for her general store and fishponds.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital for general store and fishpond

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is 55 years old and lives in the village of Prk Calayugan, Brgy Sampinit, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Andres, helps her in running her businesses, especially their rice farm. The couple is blessed with four children aged from 23 to 33 years old. Two of their children have their own families already while the other two are single and attending school. Emma also has three grandchildren. She wants her two single children to finish their studies, and hopes that the business will continue to help her grandchildren and bring progress to the whole family.
Emma opened a general store with her own small capital. As the store generated a limited income, she wanted to expand it, and so decided to become a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon where she could access additional capital and buy different items to sell. The loans helped her to increase her income, which is why she was able to set up a new business – pig fattening. In addition, right in front of her general store she was able to sell fruits such as bananas and slices of papaya. From this business, she was able to earn a minimum of 7,500 PHP per month, which she used to save for her children's education and for family expenses.
Emma's previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used as additional working capital for her general store. It was paid in full and on time. Now, she has borrowed 18,000 PHP to buy additional products for her general store and feed for her pig-fattening business. The income generated from her businesses will be saved for education and family expenses. The picture shows Emma with her husband in her general store.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional products for general store and feed for pig-fattening business

loans.name: Mariefe's Group

texts.en:
Mariefe C. is from the village of Sto.T., Alicia, Isabela. She is the leader of a 17-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if anyone is delinquent or defaults.
Mariefe is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Mariefe has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 300 to 500 PHP daily.
In 2008, Mariefe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from ASKI. Mariefe plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a grown daughter. She is a small-scale entrepreneur from Znamenka. Svetlana grows rareripes, i.e. tomatoes and radishes for further sale in one of the local markets in her home town. Svetlana started this trade 16 years ago. Currently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas invested in her farming unit. Annually Svetlana spends about 8,000 – 13,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of clear, white and thermal films in different thickness for her greenhouses. She is planning to invest generated funds in further development of her business and construction of additional greenhouses on her plot of land. Svetlana has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and polyethylene greenhouse covering

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown son. She runs a small business selling clothing merchandise in one of the local markets in Mukachevo. Ludmila has been in this trade for 4 years. Her business has proven to be very stable over these past years. Currently, Ludmila has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory.

Ludmila has always believed family is her first and utmost priority in life. Her business has been a consistent source of support not only for herself but for her family as well. Ludmila is seeking a loan of 10,500 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk and grow her sales rates. We believe Ludmila’s persistence and determination will help her repay the current loan and succeed in business.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. She has been in business for 3 years. Oksana usually purchases toys wholesale and then sells them in the central town market at retail price which helps her earn good profits. Oksana is well-known at the market because the merchandise she sells is always of good quality. She is very cheerful, confident and strong-willed. 

Oksana has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas. Her profit is about 3,000 Grivnyas a month. This time Oksana is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase more inventory for further sales this holiday season. She is hoping to use the profits generated to open another vending location and provide more jobs for people. Oksana loves her job and is hoping to grow both professionally and economically.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zendia

texts.en:
Zendia V. is currently in the business of selling raw food in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and 'matoke' (plantains) to sell. Zendia is 39 years old and is widowed. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and build them a permanent house to live in.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

loans.use: stock more bags of Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and 'matoke' to sell
