loans.name: Namyoya Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Ruth is 56 years old and married with 6 children aged 38 – 20 years, having attained ‘O’ and ‘A’ level, with the last-born still in school. She also takes care of other siblings and orphans. Ruth has a poultry, brick laying, farming and rental business that she has operated from Namyoya for 25 years. She has been able to take care of her children, educate them, and offer them health care when need arises.

Ruth is mainly faced with the challenge of inadequate funds to boost her businesses, and this is why she joined her lending group. She hopes for her children to remain in good health although most of them are no longer in her care. Ruth needs a loan to re-boost her businesses, especially those that sell more during this festive season, such as the poultry business and farming so as to transport her produce to the market.

loans.use: Buying poultry feed and transporting her produce to the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy layer chicks and feed for her existing birds

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida A. is 28 years old, a mother of three, and married to Nelson. She operates a business selling clothing in the town of Migori, which is in the western part of Kenya. Helida operates her business in a busy shopping centre in Migori. She has been in this business for the last nine years and draws most of her clients from the nearby settlement and the market shoppers.

Helida learnt of KADET through a business friend who was an existing client. This is her second loan from KADET and she hopes to use the money from the loan to purchase more stock to benefit from high sales in the festive month of December.

She plans to expand her business, improve her standard of living, and educate her three children to the highest level they can achieve.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Kirowooza Group, Mukono

texts.en: M. Annet is a hard-working and determined lady with a retail shop in Kirowooza that she has been operating for 5 years. She is able to make 200,000/= as profits from her sales and she hopes that with increased stock, she can do more. Her profits help her to save, allowing her to pay school fees for her 4 children while taking care of her parents. She attracts her customers using her good customer care skills. Annet needs a loan to help restock her shop with more goods. She hopes to save more from the increased profits from this loan, and she hopes her family will continue to be in good health.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group, Mukono

texts.en: K. Steven is a friendly 24-year-old single man with no children. He has a bar business in Kirasa where he has been selling beers, sodas, and wines for 1 year now. Steven is able to make 48,000/= as profits a week and he attributes this to his good customer care and the stock he has. He hopes to expand his business further and also buy a plot of land and build a house before he can think of marrying and having children. He needs a loan to help buy more beers, sodas and wines plus mineral water to sell more during this peak season.

loans.use: Buying more beers, sodas, wines and mineral water for his bar

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe O. is 54 years old, a mother of seven and married to Edwin O.. She is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for the last nine years, after she retired from government service as a judiciary clerk. Phoebe rears mainly broiler chickens which are in high demand in Kisumu City. Her clientele are individual clients and hotels within Kisumu.

This will be her second loan from KADET and she hopes to use this loan to purchase more chicks for rearing and also purchase poultry feed.

Pheobe aspires to build a home on a piece of land she owns within Kisumu City and also diversify to other business like clothes selling.

loans.use: To buy chicks and poultry feed

This is her 4th loan with the group and she is happy that her businesses are able to give her more savings. She needs a loan to help buy more produce and wood for resale.

She has been in business for 10 years and she is able to pay school fees for her children plus taking care of their general welfare. Emma is the leader of a trust bank group called Redeemer. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.  It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford. Emma, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Understand Group

texts.en: Salamatu is 35 old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. She trades in textile materials. Salamatu is the leader of a trust bank group called Understanding. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.  It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford. Salamatu, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use. Poni is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has four children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

Patricia is the leader of a trust bank group called Five Virgins. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford. Patricia, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

Weliba is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has five children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a boutique.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 23 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Faustina works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She trades in onions. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Faustina treks to nearby communities to sell as well. She has been in business for more than eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Eva is 34 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. Janet is the leader of a trust bank group called Good Luck. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. Janet stands left in the photograph.

Doruka is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Efua is a fish monger. She has one child and the child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store.

texts.en: Rebecca is 49 years old. She is not married and has no children. However, she caters for three nieces who are in school. She lives with her nieces in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Rebecca trades in soft drinks. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Lord of Host. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to make paste for sale. Sunday is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family's settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Neima

texts.en:
Neima C. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in a market and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Neima is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is an engineer. She has six children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Nancy se dedica ala venta de comida y refrescos desde hace varios años el cual ha sido su sustento y la manera de ayudar a su esposo a pagar los gastos básico de agua y luz y lo necesario, el trabaja como agente de ventas. Procreo tres hijos dos independientes de ella, la menor esta a su cuido, en los últimos meses las ventas han sido bajas lo que implica obtener ganancias, retrasar los pagos. Todo esto se ha dado por la crisis en la economía en el país, todo mas caro, con la sequía aumentaron de precio la canasta básica y mucha gente en desempleo son las causas de las ventas bajas. En sus créditos anteriores ah logrado invertir el inventario para preparar los alimentos. Hoy tiene la necesidad construir el baño y cerrar el inodoro para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene como una mejor privacidad para su familia. Agradeciendo Afodenic por los préstamos el cual ha hecho de su vida una mejor estabilidad de equilibrio en su negocio como las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy has worked for many years selling food and soft drinks. This has been her way of providing for herself and helping her husband to pay for basic needs such as water and electricity. Her husband works as a sales agent. She raised three children. Two of them are adults and the third is still in her care. In the last few months her sales have lagged, which has meant difficulties in making a profit, and delaying payments. All of this has occurred because of the economic crisis in Nicaragua. Everything is more expensive and a drought has meant that the cost of basic goods has gone up. This, as well as the many people who are unemployed, are the causes of her poor sales. With earlier loans, Nancy has been able to invest in inventory to prepare her foods. Now she needs to build a bathroom and enclose the toilet in order to improve the hygiene in her home and provide her family with more privacy. She thanks Afodenic for the loans, which have made her life more stable and balanced, both in her business and in the improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand and cement to buid a bathroom and enclose the toilet

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es: El joven Ricardo F. tiene 24 años de edad, trabaja como analista de bodega desde hace tres años, han sido mucho días difíciles cuando empezó lo hizo como ayudante de bodega, luego por su empeño laborar lo ascendieron el cual ha estado contento ya que sus ingresos mejoraron, se caso y su esposa le tiene una niña de años, pero vive en la casa de su suegra lo cual  es bastante incomodo ya que no tiene la privacidad deseada. Desde que comenzó a trabajar ha ido recogiendo para hacer su propia casa. Ya que su deseo es lograr poder tener lo propio, con sus ahorros logro comprar el terreno ya, y con este préstamo comenzara  a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a  construir su casa poco a poco por que esta muy caro los materiales comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y perlines para comenzar la obra. Todo esto lo esta logrando con el apoyo de Afodenic mediante el financiamiento de prestamos a largo plazo. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir escalando de puesto, para un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
Ricardo F., 24, has worked as an analyst for a convenience store for three years. There were many difficult days when he started as an assistant in the convenience store. Later, he was promoted because of his work effort. He has been happy because his income improved. He got married, and he and his wife have a daughter. But, they live in his mother-in-law’s house. This is pretty uncomfortable because they do not have the privacy they would like. Since he started working, he has been gathering money to make his own house. His wish is to be able to have his own. He was able to buy the land with his savings. With this loan he will start to buy construction materials to start building his house little by little. It is very expensive to buy the materials. He will buy materials like rocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc and beams to start the work. He is doing all of this with the help from Afodenic through long term loans. One of his objectives is to keep advancing in his work in order to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like rocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc and beams to start building his house

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora mujer esforzada, con deseo de superación tiene 39 años el cual ha logrado formar una bonita familia,  procreo un hijo, y su propio negocio una pequeña peluquería y venta de cosméticos lo hizo con la necesidad de poder ser una mujer independiente y para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gatos el  trabaja como cadete de taxi,  ambos han formado una vivienda aun no muy segura pero es su meta poder terminarla cerrar toda de concreto, lo que desea construir es una cocina para mejor seguridad y higiene de su pequeña casa, el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro y comenzar la obra, sastifecha con el los financiamiento otorgados ya que ha logrado las mejoras para su negocio como las mejoras de su vivienda para un techo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is a hard-working woman with the desire to succeed. She is 39, and she has a beautiful family. She has one child. She has her own business, a small beauty salon where she also sells cosmetics. She did this because she had the need to be able to be an independent woman and to be able to help her husband with the expenses. He works as a taxi driver. They have both made a house, but it is still not very safe. Her goal is to be able to finish the house by enclosing everything in concrete. What she wishes to do is to build a kitchen with better security and hygiene in her small house. She will buy construction materials like rocks, sand, cement, and iron and start the work. She is happy with the loans she has received because she has been able to make improvements in her business and her home in order to have a decent dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement, and iron to build a kitchen

loans.name: Nemesio De Jesus

texts.es: Don Nemesio vive en un barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, casado, con dos hijos, su trabajo es como conductor lo cual su salario no le ajustado para hacer su casa con mejores condiciones, con los préstamo anteriores ha venido comprando los materiales como: piedra, arena, hierro pero no ha comenzado  a construir por que no le ha ajustado, ya que todo esta estos productos  están alto en costo pero espera con este comenzar a hacer su casa de concreto. Y poder gozar de un techo digno en donde pueda ver sus esfuerzos a si como dar las gracias a la institución por el financiamiento ya que si no fuera por este medio no lograría las mejoras por su posición económica ya que solo mediante  el crédito le es posible .contento por este logró, ya que terminara su casa.
texts.en:
Nemesio lives in the Lomas del Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is married and has two children. He works as a driver. His salary has not sufficed to make improvements on the condition of his house. With the previous loans he has been buying materials like rocks, sand, and iron. But, he has not started to build because he could not afford it. All of the products are expensive. With this he plans to make his house concrete. Then he will enjoy a decent dwelling where he can see his efforts. He thanks the institution for the loan. If it were not for the loans, he would not be able to make the improvements because of his economic situation. It is only possible through the loan. He is happy that he will finish his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, and iron to begin making his house concrete

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ángela es una mujer humilde, trabajadora que ha podido criar a sus cinco hijos y ayudar con los gastos básicos de la casa a su marido. Ella trabaja como conserje en una casa social, también lava, plancha ajeno para poder cubrir los gastos ya que su salario es poco y con el lavado se ayuda mas, ya que el salario de su esposo es poco  también ya que labora como vigilante. Su casa es mitad de concreto y mitad de tabla no son las mejores condiciones pero si contenta por tener su casita. Con este préstamo quiere construir un cuarto el cual comprara los materiales de construcción para comenzar a  construir y poder tener mas comodidad ya que la casa no tiene las divisiones debidas pero que tienen que acomodarse  abecés por no tener la condiciones económica para hacer las mejoras, pero que esta logrando con los créditos que Afodenic esta dando para su necesidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Angela is a humble hardworking woman who has been raising her five children and helping her husband with the basic household expenses. She works as a janitor at a community center. Since her wages are low, Angela also offers laundry and ironing services to cover her expenses. Her husband works as a watchman, but his salary is low as well.

Angela’s house is made of half concrete and half wooden planks. Although she is happy to have a house, it is not in the best condition. With this loan, she will purchase construction materials so that she can start building a room to make her home more comfortable. Her house does not have dividers, so she has to live with what she has since she does not have the finances to make these improvements. However, she will be able to make these necessary changes with the loans from AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, cement, and iron to build a room

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Vilma ha logrado tener su propio negocio y se siente sastifecha por ser una mujer independiente, procreo dos hijos los cuales están cursando los estudios para un porvenir mejor. Su esposo es abogado y han venido haciendo mejoras a su casa, ella vende comida, refresco desde hace varios años, con ayuda de su esposo y préstamos ha logrado crecer en las ventas, la venta de comida se requiere de mucho capital para hacer un menú variado y captar clientes, así como comprar mesas, asientos, utensilios entre otros. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, pollo, frutas, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros productos para preparar los ricos platillos y seguir fortaleciendo su pequeño comedor para un futuro mejor de la familia todo esto lográndolo por los financiamiento que como muchas familias Nicaragüenses, tenemos la oportunidad de crecer como mujeres responsables, trabajadora de nuestra familia.
texts.en:
Vilma has managed to have her own business and feels satisfied in that she is able to be an independent woman. She has 2 children who are in school in order to have a better future. Her husband is a lawyer and they have been making improvements to their house. She has had a business selling food and drinks for a number of years. With the help of her husband and loans she has managed to make her sales grow. The sale of food requires a lot of capital in order to make a varied menu and gain clients, as well as to buy tables, chairs, utensils, etc. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of staple grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, fruit, candies, and soft drinks among other products, to prepare the rich dishes and to continue to strengthen her small eatery for a better future for her family. This financing allows Vilma and many other Nicaraguans to have the opportunity to grow as responsible women working for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, fruit and candies to prepare the meals

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Fanny desde hace varios años, tiene una tienda de ropa variada en un modulo del mercado, es ropa de segunda que vende en buen estado y buen precio. Lo inicio con la necesidad de poder apoyar a sus cinco hijos de los cuales todos son mayores y a su esposo con algunos gastos. Con el tiempo dos hijos emigraron  a los Estado Unidos el cual recibe remesas, pero su mas deseo es poder volverlos haber. Sus planes es poner un establecimiento de ropa en su casa para aprovechar el vecindario ya que se vende mucho por su precio bajo ya que todo esta caro, y no se ajusta ni para la canasta básica de muchas familias Nicaragüenses por la posición económica del país. El desequilibrio, el desempleo son algunos factores de esta crisis. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar varias pacas para aumentar las ventas y poder ganar más dinero, en este mes de diciembre se vende bastante. Es por eso la necesidad de aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
For several years Fanny has had a store selling various clothes in a stall in the market. She sells second hand clothes that are in good condition for a good price. She started because she needed to be able to help her five children, who are all grown, and her husband with some expenses. In time, two children emigrated to the United States. They send money, but her biggest wish is to be able to see them again. Her plan is to set up a clothing establishment in her house to profit from being in the neighborhood. She sells a lot because her prices are low. Everything is expensive, and many Nicaraguan families cannot afford the basics in food because of the economic situation in the country. Hardships and unemployment are some of the factors in this crisis. With this loan she wants to buy various bundles to increase sales and be able to earn more money. In this month of December there are plenty of sales. That is why she needs to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various bundles of clothes to increase sales

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela P. no parece en la fotografía, quien aparece es el esposo.

 La señora Mayela quiere apoyar a su marido ya que en este momento se le esta presentando una oportunidad muy buena; al esposo le ofrecen una concesión para transporte colectivo en el que le dejara muy buenos ingresos. 
El señor ya desde hace 9 años trabaja como chofer, pero las placas de su camión son rentadas en el que tiene que pagar cada semana una cuota, es por ello que esta familia quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad ya que para obtener esta concesión le solicitan gastos de papelería y tramites para hacer el traspaso y así el tener sus propias placas.
texts.en:
Mayela P. does not appear in the photograph; it is her husband who appears. Señora Mayela wants to support her husband since at this moment he has been presented with a very good opportunity; he has been offered the opportunity to obtain a collective transport concession that would generate very good income. For 9 years he has worked as a driver, but the plates on his bus are rented and he has to pay a fee every week. For this reason the family would like to take advantage of this opportunity. In order to obtain the concession they must incur expenses for paperwork and documents to make the transfer so that they can have their own plates.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the transfer of a collective transport concession

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel F. Méndez y su hermano Gabriel tienen un negocio de Abarrotes y servicio de Computadoras con Internet este negocio es llamado “Abarrotes Marely”  ya tiene 7 meses que empezó y en el cual han observado que les esta funcionando muy bien, es por ello que quieren comprar 2 computadoras mas ya que los clientes hay veces que no alcanzan computadora y ellos desean dar un mejor servicio al cliente. Para poder realzar su proyecto ellos necesitan capital para hacer esta compra y así obtener mas ingresos en esta época del año.
texts.en:
Ángel F. Méndez and his brother Gabriel have a grocery store business where they also sell internet access. This store is called "Abarrotes Marely." They started this business 7 months ago and they have observed that it is working very well. For this reason they want to buy 2 more computers, since the customers at times cannot get on a computer, and they want to provide better service for their customers. In order to carry out this project they need capital to make the purchase, and in this way obtain higher earnings during this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 computers for their business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 59 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana comienza con sus ventas diarias, ya que la gente que vive por su barrio sale a trabajar muy temprano. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y persuasiva, lo cual ha hecho que tenga mayor preferencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse tan temprano, ya que en las temporadas de frío se le hace muy difícil.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Luz con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que lleguen en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 59, is a woman who has worked hard throughout her life in order to succeed. She lives in her own home, and what he most desires is to have a relaxing old age. Each day, she gets up very early to open her grocery store. At approximately 6:00 a.m. she is open for business since the people in her neighborhood go out to work quite early. She is a very happy and persuasive shopkeeper, which has given her a nice advantage. What she likes the most about her job is visiting with her customers. That way she can learn about what is happening in the neighborhood. She has spent 11 years at this job, and having to get up so early is the part that she considers the most difficult. It is especially hard for her during the colder seasons. This is Luz's sixth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in her repayments, and she hopes to continue doing so now. She is a very responsible member of her community bank, and she is very attentive to the decisions reached in the group. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to buy more products to better supply her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the selection of merchandise

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Nicolaza, de 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su negocio está ubicado en el Centro Comercial Nº 2 (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto de comida es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo, siendo su especialidad el arroz con huevo y papas fritas, platillo con el cual se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo esta afición, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes al mismo tiempo. 
Con el tiempo, Nicolaza espera juntar el dinero necesario para implementar un restaurante donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nicolaza con MFP, sabe que tiene que invertir bien el dinero si quiere que su negocio progrese, en su banco comunal es una socias muy alegre y activa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Nicolaza is 46, a hard-working and determined woman, who lives in her own home. What she wants most in her life is to get ahead. Her business is located in the Commercial Center Number 2 (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her food stand is very popular with people who want to have delicious food. Her specialty is rice with eggs and fried potatoes, a dish which has become very well-known among the patrons. What she likes most about her work is cooking: she has loved it since she was a child. She’s been working in this for 7 years and says that the hardest part is also taking care of the customers at the same time. With time Nicolaza hopes to raise the necessary money to open a restaurant where she can offer better service to her customers. This is the fourth loan that Nicolaza has had with MFP. She knows that she has to use the money well if her business is going to improve. In her communal bank she is one of the happiest and most active members. With the thousand new sols that she is asking for, she will buy more ingredients to make delicious food.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare delicious food

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, D. 61 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal D. sobresalir en la vida.
En la pequeña habitación donD. duerme, Timotea teje a mano las artesanías más coloridas del mercado, ella realiza tejidos a pedido, ya que los modelos que elabora son muy especiales y necesariamente se tienen que hacer a mano. A parte D. trabajar a pedido, también tiene un puesto D. venta en la ciudad D. Puno, donD. todos los sábados ofrece sus tejidos a las personas que asisten a la feria.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su cuarto cumpliendo con los pedidos. 
Para el futuro, Timotea espera poder comprar una máquina D. tejer, ya que también desea incursionar en este tipo D. prendas artesanales.

Este es el tercer préstamo D. Timotea con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana parta elaborar nuevos tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Timotea, age 61, is a very likable and cheerful woman who lives in her own house together with her family, and who is willing to work very hard in order to get ahead in life. In the little room she sleeps in, Timotea makes handmaD. weavings which are the most colorful in the local market. She prepares weavings to order, since her weavings are very special and must be created by hand. In addition to filling orders, she also has a sales stall in the city of Puno, where she offers her weavings each Saturday to the people who visit the market. She has done this work for 20 years, and what she likes best about it is the weaving, which she carries out with great patience. She thinks the most difficult part is staying all day in her room filling orders. In the future, Timotea hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine, since she would also like to branch out into other types of handmaD. garments. This is Timotea's third loan with MFP, and she expects to be very punctual with her payments, since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. She is very satisfied with her communal bank, and she knows it will help her to make progress. With the 1500 Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will purchase more wool to create new handmaD. weavings.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida, de 25 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive sola en una habitación alquilada y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para salir adelante.
Su negocio es la venta de frutas, todas las mañanas sale muy temprano con su triciclo a vender ambulatoriamente por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. Entre las frutas que vende se encuentran los mangos, uvas, manzanas, duraznos, etc.,  los cuales vende a precios muy accesibles, motivo por el cual tiene muchos clientes.
Lo que más le gusta a Zoraida de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad para elegir sus horarios laborales, lleva 5 realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Con el paso del tiempo, espera tener un puesto en algún mercado de la ciudad  donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus frutas.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Zoraida con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, por lo que está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar del grupo. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más frutas para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Zoraida, age 25, is a very cheerful and hardworking young woman. She lives alone in a rented room, and what she desires most is to work very hard to get ahead. Her business is selling fruit; every morning she leaves very early on her three-wheeled vehicle to sell her products as a traveling vendor on the streets of the city of Juliaca. Among the types of fruit she sells are mangos, grapes, apples, peaches, and others. She sells them at very affordable prices, and thus she has many customers. What Zoraida likes most about her work is that she has the freedom to choose her working hours. She has done this work for 5 years, and she thinks the hardest part is having to walk all day in search of customers. As time goes by, she hopes to obtain a place in one of the city's markets, where she can sell her fruit in a more tranquil manner. This is Zoraida's second loan with MFP; she is very happy about this credit opportunity, and she is determined to make all of her payments on time. She is a very popular member within her communal bank, since she is always concerned with the well-being of the group. With the 1200 Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will purchase more fruit in order to increase the quantity of products she sells on a regular basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 31 años, vive con el amor de su vida (María), de 30 años; con ella tiene 5 pequeños hijos: Flor de 8, Charles de 6, Nique de 4, Yahaira de 2 y su último bebé, Dicson de 2 meses. Ellos viven juntos en su apacible casa propia ubicada en la selva central del Perú.

Él se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y yuca, pero también trabaja como obrero para otras personas porque aún no ha podido tener sus tierras propias. Cada día labora con mucho ahínco y las fuerzas no se le agotan porque quiere que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y lleguen a tener una profesión. Aunque no sea su tierra que trabaja, él debe hacer que produzca en cantidad y es por eso que su trabajo es bien pagado, además le gusta mucho la agricultura. Pero a Alejandro no sólo lo contratan otros campesinos, sino también viveros de grandes empresas para que les preste mantenimiento a sus plantaciones. 
Él es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a la tierra, es por eso que anhela tener varias chacras donde pueda cultivar los productos que brinda la buena tierra. Para lo cual viene ahorrando y sabe que pronto podrá cumplir sus metas.

Este el primer préstamo que Alejandro tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable en cada pago, y realizarlo de manera puntual. A su vez, está muy satisfecho con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son personas que conoce y sabe que también serán responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará su primera chacra donde cultivaré café, plátano y yuca.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 31 years old and lives with the love of his life, María, who is 30. The couple has five small children: Flor, 8; Charles, 6; Nique, 4; Yahaira, 2; and their last baby, Dicson, who is 2 months old. They live together in their own peaceful house, which is located in the central jungle of Peru. Alejandro's work is cultivating coffee, plantains and yucca, but he works as a laborer for other people, since he has not yet been able to acquire his own fields. Each day, he works with great dedication, and his energy does not run out, because he wants his children to have a good education and grow up to pursue a profession. Although it is not his own land that he is working on, he is determined to make it produce abundantly, and for that reason he is well-paid for his work; in addition, he truly enjoys farming. Alejandro is not only hired by other farmers in the countryside, but also by large agricultural companies, who hire him to maintain their plantations. He is a very hard-working man and one dedicated to the soil, and thus his desire is to acquire some plots of land where he can cultivate the products that come from the good earth. He has been saving up for this purpose, and he knows that soon he will be able to reach his goals. This is Alejandro's first loan with MFP, and he has made a commitment to be very responsible with each payment and to make them all on time. He is also very satisfied with the members of his communal bank, since they are people he knows, and he knows they will also be responsible with their payments. With the funds he is requesting, he will purchase his first piece of land, where he will cultivate coffee, plantains and yucca.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing land for farming

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 23 años, vive muy feliz al lado de su pareja (Iván), de 24 años; ellos tienen 2 pequeños niños: Jans de 7 y Juan de 2 años, pero están esperando su tercer hijo, pues ella está con 5 meses de embarazo.

Los días de Carolina actualmente son muy apacibles, bebido a su estado, por lo que no puede hacer mucho esfuerzo. Sin embargo, ayuda a su esposo con sus cultivos de agricultor de café, él es uno de los mayores productores de la zona. Aunque ella es muy joven ha sabido asumir muy bien el rol de madre y esposa, porque sabe que salir adelante no es fácil, solo se logra con la lucha constante, es así que ella a pesar de su avanzado estado de embarazo trabaja en sus chacras y según comenta, lo realizará hasta que pueda.
Una de sus metas es ampliar sus tierras para sembrar en mayor cantidad el café, producto que les permite vivir y mantenerse sin problemas. Carolina considera la labor agrícola rentable porque les genera buenas ganancias, las que le ha permitido comprar su casa propia y seguir cultivando. Ella está convencida que sus hijos continuarán con la siembra del café cuando crezcan, pero también quiere que sigan con sus estudios superiores en la ciudad.

Este es el primer préstamo que esta joven madre de familia tiene con MFP y asegura será responsable en cada pago, además conoce a los integrantes de su banco comunal y sabe que serán muy puntuales también. Ella tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de semilla de café y abono para darle mantenimiento a sus tierras y logara que produzcan en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Carolina is 23 years old and lives happily alongside her partner Ivan, who is 24. They have two small children, Jans (age 7) and Juan (age 2). She is 5 months pregnant with their third child.

Carolina’s days are very quiet now since she is not able to exert much effort. Nevertheless, she helps with her husband with his coffee crops since he is one of the top producers in the area. Although she is young, Carolina has taken to her role of wife and mother very well. She knows that success does not come easy, so every day is a constant struggle to stay ahead. Even though she is in the advanced stages of her pregnancy, Carolina says she will continue working as long as she can.

One of her goals is to acquire more farmland so that she can produce coffee in larger quantities. This product allows her family to live and support themselves. Carolina considers farming to be profitable because she generates good earnings which have enabled her buy her own home and continue her livelihood. She is convinced that her children will follow in her footsteps growing coffee, but she also wants them to continue with their higher education in the city.

This is the first loan this young mother has received from MFP. She assures us that she will be responsible with each of her payments because she knows the members of her Communal Bank are punctual with their payments. Carolina will use the funds to purchase coffee seedlings and compost for maintaining her land so that her crop yield will result in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee seedings & compost

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
Dany es un joven de 18 años, vive junto a sus padres: Luis de 50 años y Rosa de 42, y con sus 8 hermanos que ayudan con la economía de su hogar como él, a pesar de sus pocos años.
Él se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y café en su chacra propia, la cual su madre le cedió como parte de la división de tierras entre todos sus hermanos. Desde muy pequeño quiso ayudar a sus padres, pero éstos le decían que debía crecer, por ello empezó a ayudarlos desde que tenía 11 años por voluntad propia, y le gustó mucho hacerlo, además se dio cuenta que las propinas crecían y las ganancias eran muy buenas. Hoy sabe que mientras mayor tiempo le dedique a su chacra, mejor será la producción y obtendrá mejores ganancias. 
Este joven agricultor tiene muchas metas por cumplir: quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad, lograr estudiar dos profesiones (agronomía y administración) en la ciudad, pues ambas le gustan y quisiera ejercerlas en la zona donde vive, ya que tiene las esperanzas de que esta parte de la selva del Perú surgirá como una de las mejores productoras de frutas y café.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual y responsable como en todo lo que hace, porque según él dice: “la juventud no es motivo para ser desganado”.  El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Dany is a young man who is 18 years old and lives with his parents, Luis (age 50) and Rosa (age 42). He has 8 siblings who also help with the household expenses even though they are young.

Dany grows bananas and coffee on his own property, which his mother gave him as part of the land that was divided among all of the siblings. His parents have helped him since he was a young boy, but then they told him that he needed to grow up. They began helping him when Dany was 11 years old and he approached them for their assistance. He really enjoyed farming and also realized the profits were good and that his parents provided him with good advice. Today, Dany knows that the more time he devotes to his farm, the better his production improves and the greater profits he is able to achieve.

This young farmer has many goals he wants to complete: growing larger quantities of crops and taking classes in the city for two trades (agriculture and administration, since wants to be able to do both). He hopes that this part of the Peruvian jungle will emerge as one of the top producers of both fruit and coffee.

This is his first loan with MFP. Dany promises to be punctual and responsible in everything he does. He says, “Youth is no reason to become apathetic.” The money he requested will be used to purchase compost and fertilizers for maintaining his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 30 años y muchas ganas de salir adelante; él vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar junto a su esposa (Reyna), de 23 años. Por ahora no tienen hijos, pero esperan en el futuro convertirse en padres.

Este hombre trabajador se dedica al cultivo de café y plátano en sus amplias chacras desde hace dos años, además se dedica paralelamente a trabajar como obrero para otras personas, ya que también éste es un trabajo muy rentable, sobretodo en época de cosecha que faltan manos para recoger los frutos frescos que brinda esta zona del Perú.
A Edgar le gusta cosechar sus tierras y también en las ajenas porque con las ganancias que obtiene puede comprar algunas cosas para empezar a formar su hogar, además para el futuro piensa ampliar su chacra y sembrar café en mayor cantidad para convertirse en el mejor productor de la zona, pues él piensa que “no importa la profesión o el oficio que puedan tener los hombres, lo importante es que lleguen a ser los mejores en el rubro que se desempeñan”. 
Así transcurren los días de Edgar, quien cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y así se dan fuerzas mutuamente para salir adelante y concretar todos los planes que tiene para el futuro.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable en los pagos, además está muy contento con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque está compuesto por personas conocidas y trabajadoras como él. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono y plantas de café para empezar el proyecto de sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Edgar is 30 years old and eager to get ahead. He lives peacefully at home with wife Reyna, who is 23. The do not have any children at the moment, but they hope to become parents in the future.

This hardworking gentleman has been growing coffee and bananas in his wide-open fields for the past two years. At the same time, he works for other people as a field laborer. He considers this type of work to be very profitable, especially around harvest time when he lacks the help to pick fresh fruit to supply this region of Peru.

Edgar enjoys working both on his land and in other people’s fields because, with his earnings, he is able to buy a few things to begin construction of his home as well as pursue future plans to expand his farm and plant more coffee. He plans to become the best producer in the area. Edgar believes, “It doesn’t matter what profession or occupation you have. What matters is that you become the best in the field of work that you choose.” Edgar keeps his days busy and is helped by his wife. They provide strength for one another and encourage each other to succeed and fulfill their plans for the future.

This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to be responsible with his payments. Edgar is very happy with the other members of his Communal Bank because they are well-known and hard workers just like him. With the money he requested, Edgar will buy compost and coffee plants for starting a project to grow these crops in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & coffee plants

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo es un carismático hombre de 35 años, vive con su esposa (Karina), de 25 años, y con sus 3 menores hijos: Jelcy de 13, Nicole de 11 y Paola de 3 años. Ellos viven en su acogedora casa propia ubicada en la selva central peruana.

Desde muy joven cultiva café y plátanos en sus tierras, estos son los frutos que brinda la naturaleza en abundancia por esta parte del Perú Hugo aprendió desde muy pequeño y se esforzó por mejorar la técnica agrícola para ponerla en práctica en sus chacras, pues tiene muchos deseos de progresar en la vida.
Cada día despierta con la idea de mejorar para brindarles una buena calidad de vida a sus pequeños, como él mismo comenta: “al principio no me gustaba la agricultura, pero la necesidad económica hizo que trabaje con gusto, sobretodo por mis hijos”; es así como Hugo aprovecha al máximo esta actividad y obtiene muy buenas ganancias económicas.
Para el futuro le gustaría sembrar en mayor cantidad, ya que en la temporada de café puede aumentar sus ganancias y así ofrecer lo mejor a su familia. 

Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con cada pago, pues sabe que la confianza se devuelve con confianza. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido con su banco comunal compuesto por personas trabajadoras como él. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono y plantas de café para mejorar la cosecha futura.
texts.en:
Hugo, 35, is a charismatic man who lives with is wife, Karina, 25 and their three children: Jelcy, 13, Nicole, 11, and Paola, 3. They live in their own, cozy house located in the Peruvian central jungle. From a very early age he has grown coffee on his lands. Coffee grows abundantly in this part of Perú. He learned how to cultivate coffee while very young and he worked hard to implement improved agricultural practices on his farmlands because he has a strong desire to do well in life. Every day he awakens with the goal in mind to provide his children with a better quality of life. As he himself tells us: "in the beginning I didn't enjoy farming much but economic necessity forced me to work happily, most of all for my children." This is how Hugo makes the most of this activity and earns good financial rewards from it. For the future, Hugo would like plant more since the coffee growing season can provide increased income thus offering the best for his family. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay punctually because he knows that trust is rewarded with trust. On the other hand, he is committed to his communal bank, which is made up of working people like him. With the requested funds he will buy coffee seedlings and natural fertilizer to improve his crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, tiene 21 años y vive muy alegre con su esposo (Ángel), de 23 años, y con su hija Luz de sólo 2 años, por quien se desviven trabajando para salir adelante.

Junto a su esposo, cultiva café y plátanos, pero ellos no tienen tierras propias y trabajan para otras personas, por lo que reciben un sueldo. Aunque no sean suyas las tierras que cuidan, igual realizan el trabajo con mucho esmero y preocupación, porque saben que mientras su trabajo sea más cuidadoso la tierra producirá en mayor cantidad y durante la  temporada de cosecha ellos tienen trabajo asegurado y deben aprovecharlo porque las ganancias son rentables y les alcanza para vivir sin preocupaciones.
A pesar de ser una pareja que recién está empezando quieren lo mejor para su pequeña hija, es por eso que ya tienen pensado en el futuro comprar una chacra propia donde puedan trabajar para ellos mismos y así salir progresar más rápido.

Aunque este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella está muy comprometida y entusiasmada en cumplir con sus pagos, ya que quiere solicitar otros más adelante para terminar con cada meta que se ha planteado en la vida. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono, y con otra parte terminará de construir su casa, colocando la tubería de agua y desagüe, pues así podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Judith, 21, is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. He lives happily with her husband, Ángel, 23, and their 2-year-old daughter, Luz, for whom they give their life working to see her get ahead in life. She and her husband farm coffee and bananas but they don't have their own farmlands; they are salaried employees of others. Even though the lands they care for are not theirs, they work diligintly and carefully becuse they know that the more care they put into their work the better their production will be and during harvest time they will have guaranteed jobs; they must take advantage of this because profits are good and they can live worry-free. Despite being a couple that is just starting out together, they want the best for their daughter. This is why they are already planning to buy their own farmlands so that they can work for themselves and get ahead quicker. Although this is her first loan with MFP, she is very committed and enthusiastic about meeting her repayment obligations because she wants to be able to get more loans later on to meet the goals she has set up for her life. The funds requested now will be used in part to buy natural fertilizer and in part to finish building her house. They will lay water and sewerage pipes to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and do home improvements.

loans.name: Niger

texts.es:
Níger es un joven trabajador de 18 años, vive con su padre, su madre y sus 10 hermanos. A pesar de su juventud él sabe que sólo saldrá adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Desde muy pequeño Níger veía como sus padres cultivaban la tierra y así aprendió cómo hacerlo; desde que tuvo 10 años empezó a ayudarlos a sembrar, después se dio cuenta que la cosecha daba fruto con su apoyo. Desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura de plátano y café, productos que se producen en gran cantidad en esta zona del Perú. 
A sus cortos 18 años quiere ser un gran productor cafetalero de la zona y ambiciona llegar a ser el mejor, además quiere estudiar medicina porque sabe que debe tener su profesión aparte de sus productivas tierras. Él trabaja independientemente porque sus padres le cedieron un pedazo de tierra, de lo que le tocaba en herencia; y así, a diario se esfuerza por sembrar más y obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan costearse sus estudios en la ciudad.
A Níger le gusta mucho trabajar la tierra y ya piensa en ampliar su chacra para sembrar más café y plátano.

Él es muy responsable y promete que así lo demostrará en cada pago que realice, porque quiere tener más préstamos para llegar a concretar sus sueños. Por otro lado, está muy satisfecho con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque conoce bien a las personas que lo componen y sabe que son trabajadoras como él. Con el dinero que solicita tiene planeado comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras y así obtener una cosecha segura.
texts.en:
Niger, 18, is a hard-working, young man who lives with his parents and 10 siblings. Despite his youth he knows that he will only get ahead in life through much hard work. From a very young age, Niger learned how to farm watching his parents work the land. From the age of 10 on he helped them plant and later would see that harvests were good thanks to his help. From then on he has farmed bananas and coffee, two products that are grown plentifully in this area of Perú. At the young age of 18 he wants to be a big coffee planter in the region; in fact, he wants to be the best. He also wants to study medicine because he realizes that he must have a profession besides being a productive farmer. He works independently because his parents gave him his own piece of land that would have been his inheritance. He thus makes the effort every day to plant more and earn good profits which will enable him to pay for his studies in the city. Niger enjoys working the land very much and plans to enlarge his farmlands in order to plant more coffee and bananas. He is very responsible and promisses to demonstrate it with every repayment he makes because he wants to be able to have future loans in order to see his dreams come true. On the other hand, he is very pleased with the members of his communal bank because he knows his fellow members well and he knows that they are hard-working like him. With the funds requested he plans to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his lands to insure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre muy laborioso de 54 años, vive con su esposa (Antonia), de 49 años, y con sus 5 jóvenes hijos; Luis de 29, Manuel de 22, Samuel de 19, Raquel de 18 y Raúl de 16 años.
Él se dedica a varias actividades a la vez, se podría decir que es “un mil oficios”, pues es agricultor de café y plátano, carpintero de muebles que lleva a la ciudad para venderlos a buen precio; y como si fuera poco, es albañil cuando requieren de sus servicios. Pablo dice que el tiempo le alcanza porque la actividad agrícola la desempeña con la ayuda de sus hijos, ya que les enseñó desde que eran muy pequeños las técnicas que hacían producir mucho mejor la tierra, y así tiene tiempo de sobra para darle forma a la madera, haciendo lindos muebles que con su ingenio diseña, y de vez en cuando realiza labores de albañilería que aprendió de muy pequeño viendo a su padre. Con estos oficios obtiene buenas ganancias, porque son pocos los que son carpinteros y albañiles por la zona donde vive.
Pablo es un hombre muy risueño y con muchas ganas de seguir con las metas que se propuso en la vida.

Aunque este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, promete que será muy puntual en los pagos porque quiere sacar otros prestamos más adelante, además está muy contento con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son muy organizados. Con el dinero que solicita comprará maquinaria para implementar su taller de carpintería, para   realizar el cepillado y cortado de la madera. Comprará una máquina caladora, un motor eléctrico y una cepilladora.
texts.en:
Pablo, 54, is a very hard-working man. He lives with his wife, Antonia, 49, and their 5 children: Luis, 29, Manuel, 22, Samuel 19, Raquel, 18, and Raúl, 16. He is involved in several trades at once, you might call him a "jack of all trades" because he is a coffee and banana grower, he makes furniture that he sells in the city at good prices, and, as if that weren't enough, he works as a mason when such services are required. Pablo says that he has enough time for all this because the farming is done with help from his sons since he taught them when they were still very young the skills to make the land more productive. He thus has plenty of time to shape the wood into beautiful furniture that he designs following his own creative impulses. Occasionally, he works as a mason, a skill he learned as a young boy by watching his father. These various jobs produce good earning for him because there are just a few carpenters and masons in the area where he lives. Pablo is a very cheeful man who aims to reach the goals he has set up for himself. Although this is his first loan with MFP, he commits to being punctual with his repayments because he would like to have future loans. In addition, he is happy with the members of his communal bank because they are very well organized. With the funds requested he will buy equipment for his carpentry shop to cut and sand lumber. He will buy a jig saw, an electric motor and a sander.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 41 años, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposa (Delia) de 34 años y su hijo político, José de 11 años, que cría como si fuera suyo porque él tiene la concepción de que  padre no es quien engendra si no el que cría con cariño y esmero.

Todos los días debe levantarse con los primeros rayos del sol para empezar su labor de jornalero en las chacras donde lo contratan para machetear y limpiar las plantaciones de café, plátano y cítricos. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, tiempo en que se mudó a vivir en la selva, él es oriundo de la sierra peruana. Al llegar a estas tierras le gustó tanto la manera de vivir y el trabajo que decidió establecerse con su familia y quedarse a vivir aquí, porque dice que el clima es perfecto y la tierra es muy productiva.
Como Raúl es un hombre muy emprendedor ya tiene planeado en el futuro comprar su propia chacra donde sembrará café, maíz, plátano y yuca, casi puede imaginar a sus fértiles tierras producir en gran cantidad y él feliz trabajando algo de su propiedad. Además, también quiere implementar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es el primer préstamo que Raúl tiene con MFP y asegura será muy serio en cada pago porque anhela salir adelante honradamente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un pedazo de tierra para empezar a sembrar lo que tanto desea y brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl is 41 years old and lives in peace in his home with his wife, Delia, who is 34 years old, and his 11-year-old son José, who Raúl raises as if he were his own because his biological father did not raise him with love and care. Every day, he wakes up at dawn to begin his work as a day laborer in the farms, where he is contracted to cut away and clear the coffee, banana and citrus plantations. He has been pursuing this activity for 6 years, during which time he moved to live in the forest; he is a native the Peruvian mountains. When he came to the forest, he was so pleased with the lifestyle and his work that he decided to settle there with his family. He says that the weather is perfect, and the land is very productive. Because Raúl is a very enterprising man, he has already planned to buy his own farm in the future, where he will grow coffee, corn, bananas and yucca. He can almost imagine the fertile land producing large quantities and the joy of working on his own property. Also, he wants to have a grocery store in his home. This is Raúl’s first loan with MFP, and he will make sure to be very serious about each repayment because he wants to go forward honorably. With the money that he requests, he will buy a plot of land, where he will begin planting what he wants, so as to offer his family security.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land to cultivate

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre emprendedor de 35 años, vive con su esposa (Jenny), que tiene 28 años, y con su pequeño e inquieto niño, Josué de 6 años, en su amplia casa que es propia y que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo.

En su juventud estudió agropecuaria, ya que siempre vivió rodeado de plantaciones en la selva, eso lo inspiró desde muy pequeño y así escogió estudiar esa profesión. Después de terminar su carrera volvió a su tierra a practicar todo lo aprendido; desde entonces han pasado varios años y ahora se dedica a brindar asesoramiento técnico en el campo a diferentes agricultores.
A su vez, también siembra café, plátanos y maíz en sus propias tierras, para estas labores cuenta con la ayuda del personal que contrata, además le gusta el trabajo de asesor, ya que puede ejercer su profesión en la zona donde nació y creció. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, además de las ganancias que le brinda la producción en su chacra, para el futuro tiene pensado adquirir más terrenos para sembrar y para revenderlos a mejor precio después de darles mantenimiento.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que será puntual con cada pago porque quiere seguir progresando y sabe que esto sólo lo alcanzará con honestidad. Ya tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en abono para sus tierras y también para el pago del personal que contrata para el mantenimiento de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is an enterprising 35-year-old man. He lives with his wife (Jenny), who is 28 years old, and with their small and restless child, Josué, who is 6. They live in a large house, which they own and and were able to build with a great deal of effort.

He studied farming in his youth, since he was always surrounded by plantations in the jungle. This inspired him at a very young age and that is how he chose to study that profession. After finishing his studies, he returned to his land to practice everything that he had learned. Since then, several years have passed and he now provides technical advice to different farmers in the countryside. At the same time, he also plants coffee, bananas and corn on his own lands so he also has the help of the workers that he hires. In addition, he likes working as a consultant so that he can practice his profession in the area where he was born and raised. This work is very profitable, in addition to the earnings from his small farm. In future, he plans to acquire more lands to cultivate and to resell them at a better price after doing maintenance.

This is Rodrigo's first loan with MFP and he is certain that he will be punctual with each payment because he wants to continue making process and he knows that he can only achieve this with honesty. He already plans to invest the money from the loan in fertilizer for his lands, and also for the payment of the staff that he hires to maintain his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es:
Tereso tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa Maritza de 59 años, y con 2 de sus 7 hijos: Geraldo de 15 y Bryan de 13 años; pues el resto de sus hijos son mayores y ya han formado sus propias familias.
Él pasa sus días sembrando plátano y café en sus tierras ubicadas en la zona de la selva central del Perú; le gusta mucho realizar esta actividad, ya que la zona es propicia para sembrar estos productos. Todas las mañanas Tereso se levanta muy temprano con la convicción de prosperar en la vida, él siembra  desde hace 5 años, cuando empezó con unas pocas plantas y hoy tiene una gran chacra productiva, además no se ha detenido en su trabajo porque lo considera muy rentable, pues le alcanza para vivir y dar educación a sus hijos, que son su mayor preocupación.
El trabajo de agricultor es algo tedioso, pero a Tereso lo motiva la idea de que pronto pueda tener más tierras, cosechar en mayor cantidad y obtener mejores ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que será puntual en cada uno de sus pagos porque él es un hombre de palabra. Ya pensó en invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para cuidar sus plantaciones y así obtener una cosecha segura.
texts.en:
Tereso, 52 years old, lives with his wife Maritza who is 59, and with two of their seven children, Geraldo who is 15 and Bryan, 13. The rest of their children are older and have formed their own families. He spends his days planting plantains and coffee on his fields located in the central rain-forest zone of Peru. He likes doing this quite a bit since the area is favorable for planting these products. Every morning Tereso gets up early with the determination to prosper in life. He began farming five years ago when he started with a few plants and today he has a large productive area. He hasn't stopped his work because he considers it very worthwhile, since is allows him to earn a living and provide an education to his children, who are his main concern. The work of a farmer is somewhat tedious, but Tereso is motivated by the idea that soon he will be able to have more land, harvest a larger quantity, and obtain better income. This is the first loan that he has with MFP and he is sure that he will be punctual with each of his payments because he is a man of his word. He plans to invest the money that he requests in the purchase of fertilizers to improve his plantings and thereby obtain a more certain harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 62, sells groceries.  She has been in this business for 10 years. She is married with seven children. 

Mary is a very had working woman. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to expand her business by purchasing more groceries to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salimatu

texts.en: Salimatu sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, fish, plantain and groceries.  Her husband is a commercial driver, who does the best he can to put food on the table.  Salimatu is a 38 year old mother of four children who sometimes pays part of her children’s school fees.  She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to expand her business and attract more customers by purchasing more foodstuffs and groceries to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios primarios. Ella vive con su pareja, quien es agricultor.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas de varias líneas cosméticas. Estos productos son muy demandados por las personas que viven en su zona y Ana los deja al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es aprender a dar cada día un trato mejor a sus clientes, y le es muy rentable porque tiene sus clientes selectos y regulares, quienes le piden sus productos constantemente. Para más adelante a Ana le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa.

Con MFP ya tiene 11 préstamos, a ella le gusta ser parte de un banco comunal porque considera muy bonito trabajar en equipo, pues existe mucho compañerismo y responsabilidad entre todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza y una vitrina para proteger sus productos, los cuales requieren de mucho cuidado.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old. She is mother to three children who are elementary school students. She lives with her partner who is a farmer. For six years, she has been dedicated to the sale of perfumes, cosmetics and jewelry from various cosmetic lines. These products are in high demand by people who live in her area and Ana sells them for cash or credit to her customers. What she likes about her work is learning to give better service to her customers every day and this is very profitable because she has select and regular customers who order her products regularly. Moving forward, Ana would like to have a clothing store. With MFP, she already has 11 loans. She likes to be part of a community bank because she considers it beautiful to work in a team because there is camaraderie and responsibility among the members. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more beauty products and a glass case to protect her products which require a lot of care.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 35 años, es padre de 5 hijos, los cuales están cursando estudios primarios y secundarios. Él vive junto a su esposa, quien lo apoyan en todo.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva yuca y frutos cítricos en las 4 hectáreas de tierra que posee. Pero mientras espera la época de cosecha, cría gallinas, a las que alimenta adecuadamente para que cuando las venda tengan un peso exacto y valgan un buen precio.
Para estas actividades cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposa, quienes aprovechan los espacios de terreno de su chacra para sembrar algunos productos de pan llevar, para su  consumo diario. 
Lo que le gusta a Fredy de su trabajo es mantenerse activo y enseñar a los suyos lo que va aprendiendo de la agricultura. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque cuenta con un comprador  estable de sus yucas y cítricos; y respecto de sus gallinas, su ganancia es buena cuando las vende.  

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son personas confiables y sobre todo muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más plantas de yuca para seguir sembrando (con 200 soles), y con lo restante comprará abono para fortalecer su terreno para que sus productos crezcan fuertes y sanos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 35 years old and father to five children who are students in elementary and high school. He lives with his wife who supports him in everything. For five years, he has been dedicated to agriculture, cultivating yucca and citrus fruits in the four hectares of land that he owns. However, while he awaits harvest season, he raises hens which he feeds adequately so that when he sells them they are the right weight and are valued at a good price. For these activities, he counts on the support of his children and his wife who take advantage of spaces of land on his farm to sow some bread products for their daily consumption. What Fredy likes about his job is keeping active and teaching his family what he's learning about farming. At the same time, it is very profitable because he has a consistent buyer for his yucca and citrus produce and respect for his hens. His earnings are good when he sells them. This is his second loan with MFP and what he likes about his community bank is that all the people are trustworthy and, above all, very responsible with their payments. With the money he is requesting, he will buy more yucca plants to continue planting (with 200 soles) and with the rest, he will buy fertilizer to strengthen his land so that his crops grow strong and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yucca plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 23 años, vive junto a su pareja y madre de su hijo de 2 añitos. La casa donde viven es propia.
Desde hace 5 años tiene una chacra donde también está su vivienda, allí siembra productos de pan llevar como el plátano, frutos cítricos, yuca, arroz, entre otros. Adicionalmente, cría aves de corral y cerdos. 
Lo que le gusta a Jesús de sus actividades es hacer bien su trabajo, sobre todo mantener en buen estado su chacra. Una vez que cosecha sus productos los vende, cada semana, en el mercado de su localidad, por los que obtiene buenas ganancias porque todos sus productos son de buena calidad y frescos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son unidos, se alejan de los problemas y son muy trabajadores. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá totalmente en la mayor producción de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Jesús is 23. He lives with his life partner and mother of his two year old son. The house where they live is his own. For five years he has had a farm in the same location as his house. He plants staple food crops like bananas, citrus fruits, yucca, and rice among others. He also raises poultry and pork. What Jesús likes about his activities is doing his work well. Above all, he likes keeping his farm in a good state. Once he harvests his products he sells them every week in the local market. He gets good earnings because all of his products are good quality and fresh. This is his second loan with MFP. What he likes about being part of a communal bank is that all of his colleagues are united. They keep problems away, and they are very hard-working. The money he is asking for is to invest totally in greater production on his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase agricultural production

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 56 años, es padre de tres hijos y vive con su esposa, quien siempre le brinda su apoyo en todo.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura; siembra piñas, frutos cítricos, yuca y la hoja de bijao, este último es un producto de gran demanda, pues es muy usado para la elaboración de gran variedad de comidas de su región. Jorge abastece de esta hoja a más de 50 comerciantes en el mercado de su zona. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a su esfuerzo está consiguiendo sus objetivos, pues labora muy arduamente para darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos, a quienes quiere verlos más adelante hechos unos hombres de bien. Por otro lado le es muy rentable porque sus productos siempre se venden y cuenta con clientes regulares.

Con MFP ya tiene 10 préstamos, él es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta es que sus compañeros son tranquilos y demuestran mucha responsabilidad con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará abono para sus plantas (con 2000 soles), y con el resto adquirirá materiales de construcción para mandar a refaccionar algunas partes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 56 years old. He is father to three children and lives with his wife, who has always supported him in everything. He has worked in agriculture for the last 15 years; he plants pineapple, citrus fruit, yucca and bijao leaves.
