This last products is in great demand as it commonly used in in the preparation of a wide variety of foods from his region. Jorge supplies these leaves to more than 50 merchants at the area market. What he likes about his job is that, thanks to his efforts, he is reaching his goals, since he works very hard to be able give all that is necessary to his sons, who he wants to grow up into decent men. On the other hand, he is very profitable because his products always sell, and he can count on his regular customers. Jorge has already had 10 loans through MFP. He is part of a community bank, and he enjoys that his partners are calm and show a lot of responsibility in their payments. The money that he is requesting now will go towards the purchase of fertilizer for his crops (2,000 soles worth), and with the rest he will acquire building materials to be sent to make renovations on parts of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and materials for home renovations

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos, quienes cursan estudios primarios. Ellos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la siembra de piña y yuca, él cuenta con dos hectáreas de terreno, donde también cultiva plátanos y frutos cítricos, los cuales le sirven para consumo personal. 
Pero como el terreno de su chacra es amplio que no dudo en empezar a sembrar una hectárea de palma aceitera, donde él mismo es quien cuida todas sus plantas. Lo que le gusta a Luis de su labor es mantenerse ocupado y olvidarse de los problemas, también le es muy rentable porque las ganancias de la venta de sus piñas y yucas le brindan lo necesario para vivir tranquilo.
Para más adelante, Luis quiere empezar a sembrar maíz y arroz.

Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos se apoyan, no hay problemas y se entienden bien. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará abono para sus plantaciones de piña y yuca.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and lives with the mother of his two children,both of whom are in primary school. The have their own house. For 14 years he has worked growing pineapple and yucca. He has two hectacres of land. He also grows plantains and citrus fruits, but only for personal consumption. Because his farm was large enough he also planted a hectacre of palm oil trees, which he cares for himself. What Luis likes most about his work is that it keeps him busy and he can forget his problems. Also, it is quite profitable. With the money he earns from selling his pineapples and yucca he can live comfortably. In the future Luis wants to start growing corn and rice. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he likes the community bank because all the members support each other and their aren't any problems. With the money from the loan he will purchase fertilzer for his pinneapple and yucca farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y tienen 4 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos estudiantes y uno mayor de edad, quien lo apoya en todo.
Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con 4 hectáreas de arroz  y 2 de yuca, y justamente ahora está en época de cosecha, para lo que tiene que contratar personal para la recolección de su producto. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse ocupado y tener en buenas condiciones su chacra; a su vez, le es muy rentable porque sus productos los vende a un buen precio en el mercado de su localidad. 
Para Marco, su motivación de esfuerzo son sus hijos a quienes quiere brindarles lo necesario. 

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas responsables y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más granos de arroz para seguir sembrando en su chacra,  con lo que le reste contratará personal para la cosecha de su arroz y yuca.
texts.en:
Marco is 43 years old, and he lives with his wife. They have four children; three are students, and one who is grown helps him in everything. For the last 13 years he has farmed. He has 4 acres of rice and 2 of yucca. Right now it is harvest time, so he needs to hire people to harvest his farm products.

What he likes most about his work is keeping busy and keeping his farm in good condition; in turn, the farm is very profitable because he sells his products at a good price in the local market. For Marco, the motivation for his efforts are his children, for whom he would like to provide the necessities.

This is his third loan with MFP, and what he likes about being part of a communal bank is that his fellow members are responsible and very hard working. With the money that he is asking for now, he will buy more rice to continue planting on his farm, and with the rest he will hire people for the rice and yucca harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos; dos de ellos cursan estudios primarios y los otros dos, estudios secundarios. 
Desde hace 10 años es propietario de una chacra donde también está su vivienda, allí siembra caña de azúcar y una variedad de productos de pan llevar, también cría vacas.
Para esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposa. 
En el caso de la caña de azúcar, una vez cosechada la envía a otras ciudades para su comercialización, y también la vende en el mercado local. 
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad laboral es dar todo de él y sentirse útil ante los demás, y como ya cuenta con clientes estables obtiene muy buenas ganancias.

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta trabajar de ser parte de un banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden y son puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido íntegramente en el aumento de producción de su chacra.
texts.en:
Narciso is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and their four children; two of them are in primary school and the other two in secondary school. For 10 years he has been the owner of a farm where he also lives. There he plants sugar cane and a variety of local staple foods; he also raises cattle. For these activities, he counts on the help of his children and his wife. Once the sugar cane is harvested, he sends it to other cities to be sold, and he also sells it in the local market.

His favorite part of his work is giving all of himself and feeling useful to others. Since he relies on steady customers, he obtains very good profits. This is his third loan from MFP. What he likes about working and being part of a community bank is that all his fellow members understand each other and are punctual in their payments. The money that he is asking for now will be wholly invested in increasing the production of his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase agricultural production

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar tiene 50 años, está casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos que son estudiantes.
Desde hace 6 años siembra yuca en las 2 hectáreas de terreno que posee; además, hace un año implementó un galpón en su chacra para la crianza de aves y le está yendo muy bien en este negocio.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus pollos, y sobre todo que le mantiene ocupado y trabaja durante todo el día. A su vez le es muy rentable porque para la venta de sus pollos ya cuenta con diferentes restaurantes donde los distribuye.
Para más adelante, Omar quiere empezar a vender ganado vacuno.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que son personas responsables con sus pagos, y sobre todo se conocen entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a refaccionar el galpón que tiene a sus animales y también comprará suficiente alimento para sus pollos y gallinas.
texts.en:
Omar is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their two children, who are students. For 6 years he has been planting yucca on the two hectares of land that he owns; one year ago, he also built a shed and started raising chickens on his land. This business has been going very well for him. What he likes most about his work is raising the chickens well and, above all, that it keeps him busy and he works all day. In turn, his work is very profitable; for the sale of his chickens, he already distributes them to different restaurants. In the future, Omar would like to begin selling cattle. This is his first loan with MFP, and what he likes about his community bank is that people are responsible with their payments, and above all, everyone know everyone else. With the money that he is asking for now, he will have the shed where he keeps his animals repaired, and he will also buy sufficient feed for the hens and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the shed where he raises chickens and also buy feed

loans.name: Orlith

texts.es:
Orlith tiene 58 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y su nieta, quien está estudiando.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de comida por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas se dedica a la agricultura, siembra frutos cítricos y yuca.
Sus platos de comida los vende afuera de su vivienda en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó para la ocasión. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degusten de su buena sazón, y darles una buena atención es lo que más le importa a Orlith. 
Por otro lado, lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un local apropiado para sus clientes, pues para el futuro le gustaría tener su propio restaurante.

Este es su 12avo préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta es que las personas de su grupo son personas coordinadas y muy organizadas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a construir una “ramada” (techo hecho con madera y ramas) para protegerse de las lluvias, también comprará sillas y mesas.
texts.en:
Orlith is 58 years old, is married and lives with her husband and granddaughter who is a student. For fifteen years, she has been dedicated to selling food in the evenings, since, in the mornings, she is dedicated to farming, sowing citrus fruits and yucca. She sells her dishes outside her home in a small spot that is prime for the job. What she likes most about her job is that many people enjoy her work and giving them good service is what is most important to Orlith. At the same time, what is most difficult for her is not having a suitable space for her customers. So, in the future, she would like to have her own restaurant. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She is part of a community bank and what she likes is that the people in her group are coordinated and organized. With the money that she is now requesting, she will build a "ramada" (a roof made of wood and branches) to protect her from the rains. She will also buy chairs and tables.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a roof for her food stand.

loans.name: Rodolio

texts.es:
Rodolio tiene 32 años, vive junto a su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos, quienes estudian y son su mayor inspiración de seguir adelante.
Su actividad diaria es el cultivo de plátanos, yucas, arroz, maíz y frutas silvestres (guayabas, aguajes, mangos entre otras). Sin embargo, el terreno de su chacra es tan amplio que no dudó en sembrar árboles madereros, en esto tiene un periodo de 4 años y le está yendo muy bien. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aprender más técnicas agrícolas, pues cada temporada, junto con otros agricultores, tienen capacitaciones de siembra, cultivo y cuidado de sus productos.

Este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP, él es parte de un banco comunal y lo que más le gusta es que los miembros de su grupo son personas responsables y muy comunicativas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá totalmente en la mejora y aumento de su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Rodolio is 32 years old and lives with his partner and mother of his two children, who study and are his main inspiration to get ahead in life. His daily activity is cultivating bananas, yuccas, rice, corn, and wild fruits (guavas, avocados, mangos among others.) However, the land he farms is big enough that he had no hesitation in also planting timber trees four years ago, and is doing very well. What he most likes about his work is learning new agricultural methods, and each season, along with other farmers, he learns skills for the sowing, cultivation, and care of their products.

This is his tenth loan from MFP. He is part of a communal bank and what he likes most is that the members of the group are responsible people and very communicative. The money that he is requesting at the moment he will invest in its entirety in improving and increasing his agricultural production.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his agricultural production

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en: Sabir Q. is a 47-year-old trader who sells men's and children's clothes. He started his business in 1996 when he wasn’t able to find a job. He borrowed money from his relatives and started his business with several suits, but now he has a wide range of products. Owing to first loan from AqroInvest, he could expand his business and increase revenue.  He rents a good place in the central market of Imishli city. He says that the key of success is to be honest with clients and very friendly. Sabir has a dream to build his own shop where he can sell men's clothes. Now he needs additional financial aid to purchase clothes for the winter season. As Sabir recommended himself as a good borrower with good loan history, we apply for your generosity to help this hard-working man.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo, que ya es mayor de edad y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros.
Él cuenta con una chacra, pues desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, inclinándose por la siembra y cultivo de la yuca, lo cual lo complementa con otros productos; como el plátano,  arroz, maíz y frutos cítricos. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 20 años, tiempo donde la ha ido muy bien.
Lo que le gusta a Víctor de su trabajo es trabajar duro y seguir adelante con esta labor que tanto le gusta y lo mantiene activo. La venta de la yuca es un negocio muy rentable porque su comercialización es regular y segura.
Asimismo, también lleva a vender otros productos en el mercado de su localidad, como el plátano, maíz y algunas variedades de tubérculos que produce su chacra, que también son demandados por la gente de su zona.

Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y está contento porque no tiene  problemas con sus compañeros de grupo, y todos son responsables con sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de abono para el mantenimiento de su chacra.
texts.en:
Víctor is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and his son, who is already grown and works as a passenger transport driver. Víctor has a farm; since he was very young he has worked in agriculture, mainly concentrating on planting and cultivating yucca, which he complements with other products such as plantains, rice, corn and citrus fruits. He has been doing this work for 20 years, and during this time it has gone very well for him. What Víctor likes about his profession is working hard and continuing with this labor which he enjoys so much and which keeps him active. Selling yucca is a very profitable business, because the market for it is regular and reliable. At the same time, he also takes other products to sell at the market near where he lives, such as plantains, corn and some varieties of root vegetables he produces on his farm, which are also in demand among the people of the area. This is his seventh loan with MFP; he is a member of a communal bank, and he is happy because he does not have any problems with his fellow group members, and all of them are responsible with their payments. The funds he is currently requesting will be used to buy fertilizer to maintain his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Alaskar

texts.en: Alaskar A. is 51 years old, married and has five children. His role as a father is the main one in his life, he says. Alaskar works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He has grown and sold seasonal fruits and vegetables for more than 20 years. Alaskar dreams that all of his children will be well educated and have a bright future – that is why he works from early morning until late at night.  Alaskar wants to borrow 1600 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer and necessary supplies for saving his products because he wants to sell them later when the price for them will increase. This loan request is to make Alaskar's dream come true, and he is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif N. is 22 years old. He is single but a responsible son of his family who relies on him. Vasif sells children's clothing in the center bazaar in Imishli city. Five years ago, he started as a seller. Gradually, he saved some money and with financial support of his dearest parents, he started his own business. Now he is a very experienced entrepreneur and manages his business, trying to keep his clients happy. The business is successful and generates a stable income for the family. Today, Vasif is requesting 1600 AZN for the purchase of new children's clothing for winter to sell. Vasif thanks everyone supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time. His biggest dream is to have his own family and he believes this loan will be a significant step to approach his dream.

loans.use: To purchase children`s winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh A. is a 43-year-old entrepreneur who sells spare parts in his own spare parts shop. He is married and has 2 children, who are the apple of his eye. He started his business in 1998, when he couldn’t find a job in his city. He borrowed money from his friends, and with starting capital of $100 he began selling car headlights. He says that his main goal is to save enough money to build his own store, so he doesn't need to spent money on rent. He wishes to provide his children with the best education, and for this purpose he applied for a 1,600 AZN loan. This loan will help him to improve his living conditions and save money for his children’s future education.

loans.use: To purchase more car spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cases of goods to increase profit

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamella N. is a happy mother of four children. She is 60 years old and married. Tamella is a grocery store owner. For more than 15 years she has been selling foodstuff such as sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many other products in her grocery store. Tamella’s wish is to expand her business, offering various types of foodstuff to customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children, who are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity, with the immense love Tamella feels as a mother, and with her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN in order to increase the range of her goods. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Tamella.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan Q. is 48 years old and is married with two adorable daughters. He opened his grocery 7 years ago. Elkhan provides his neighbors and occasional clients with products like bread, rice, sugar, meat, milk, and other staples. He tells us that, thanks to his grocery’s early opening hours and the good service he offers his customers, he has been able to move forward with the business. Elkhan wants the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as tinned products, sweets, and drinks. He and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Mobil

texts.en:
Mobil D. is an energetic 33 year old. From the time he was young, he was looking for a way to start his own business to be able to help his parents with family expenses. With much effort, he initiated his own business with very little merchandise. Selling soft drinks and juices, little by little he was able to maintain his home and start to grow his business, also incorporating the sale of grocery items and improving the quality of service he offered. 
Mobil needs a loan of 1600 AZN, which he will use to provide more juices and soft drinks so he can continue to work hard to sustain his family. His dream is to build his own store one day. Mobil very much appreciates your support.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to increase profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng S., 53, is married with six children. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband and children. To make a living, she is involved in a business selling tobacco and betel leaves for older people at a local market in the town, earning an income of US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed as a construction worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. These sources of income help cover the family expenses. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more tobacco and betel leaves for resale. With the remainder, she wants to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work at the construction site. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: buy tobacco and betel leaves for resale and a motorbike

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan C. is from the town of Bagumbang Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Allan is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Allan raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Allan has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Allan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Allan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Allan is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Allan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is from the village of Matugas Alto,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Regina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna V. is from the village of Palilan,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Felna is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Felna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector vesting and buying fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the local community. Felna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Frances A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 30 years old. Frances is single. To make a living, Frances owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling electronic load in the local community (Frances wearing an apple green polo shirt holding a cellphone). Frances has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Frances joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Frances is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Frances from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane M. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 28 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A. is from the village of Sinonoc,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Julieta is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is a 44-year old married woman who lives in the village of Cabunggahan, Fabrica Sagay City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in ambulant vending of used clothes. Alma's husband helps her in running the business, they have 3 children who are school age: 1 in high school and 2 in the elementary level.

Alma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in ambulant vending of used clothing. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities.

Alma is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations of her ambulant vending business, and it has a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 19th cycle loan, the amount of Php 28,500, which she intends to use on her ambulant vending business. Alma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 52 years old. Laura is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegaetables in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his family. He and his wife have four children between the ages of 3 and 17, all of which attend school.  Mr. Chea S. and his wife own a small plot of land on the outskirts of the city on which they farm vegetables such as cucumbers and lettuce.  He has requested his first loan of $1,200 from CREDIT to expand his business by buying additional seeds and purchasing his neighbors’ surplus vegetables to sell them at the market alongside his own produce.  

In the future, Chea S. would like to continue to slowly increase the capacity of his farm.  Eventually he would like to expand his house to provide more room for himself, his wife and their children.  Finally, even though the bulk of his income already goes towards his children’s education, he hopes that as his business becomes more profitable, he can send all of them to better schools so that they may have more opportunities.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kimmy

texts.en:
Kimmy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 21 years old. Kimmy is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Kimmy owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of ready to wear items in the local community. Kimmy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kimmy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Kimmy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace G. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Grace is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 17,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia L. earns her living by selling an assortment of household and personal-care products in the local market. She is a 57-year-old widow who lives in Bonifacio Extention, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Cecelia has four grown-up children: one of whom already has her own family with three children and the other children are currently helping run the business. 

Cecelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she wanted to improve the quality of life of her family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income from her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 7,500 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Cecelia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her business, and it is having a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing 11,000 PHP for her 16th loan cycle which she intends to use on her business. Cecelia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for the family – to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem  that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita Q. is from the village of Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Marianita is married and has 10 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Marianita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the business's main source of income comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the Sto Nino School canteen. Aside from that, she also owns a motorcycle for her transportation business. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marianita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marianita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Mrs. Severina A., 56 years of age, is married and is a resident of Bintana, Tangub City. She is blessed with five children and four of them are already married. Her husband, Rogelio, is a farmer with an average net income of not less than P2,000 a month.

To help her husband in supporting her family, Severina decided to engage in a sari-sari (variety) store and a hog-raising business. She started these businesses five years ago and now she earns an average net income of not less than P3,500 a month. This figure is very helpful to her family in meeting their daily needs.

Severina joined Paglaum MPC just a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

As member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program, she was able to obtain multiple loans because of her outstanding credit record. This time she is given the privilege of obtaining P14,000 as her 4th loan to add to the capital of her sari-sari store and hog-raising businesses.

The future income from this loan will be used for meeting their daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store and hog-raising business

She is a widow and has three children, between the ages of 20 and 29, and they live with her and work in a local garment factory. He is a father of six children: one is married and lives separately, the second two work as motor taxi drivers, and the last three are going to school. He is married to Thy, 31, who sells clothes and some cooking ingredients in front of her home. Keo C. owns a tuk tuk (motorbike taxi) and has provided a transportation service throughout the whole town of the province since 2002. Keo C. has recently had problems with the taxi because it's too old to run and not attractive to the customers. So he is looking for his second loan of $700 to buy a new tuk tuk for his service.

texts.en: Mr. Pouv P., 30, works as a professional journalist in the private company located in the middle of Siem Reap province. Pouv P. is married but has no children. His wife, Sok Phary, 27, sells a few groceries in her own store in front of her home. This couple currently lives with their parents, who are used-goods sellers. Because this family’s house is located along the lake in a good location for fishing, Pouv P. needs a loan of $800 to buy nets and traps to begin fishing. With the rest of the loan he will buy more grocery inventory for his wife to sell. The loan will provide him with additional income to ensure that his family attains a better standard of living.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta T., 44 years of age, is widow and is a resident of Bintana, Tangub City. She is blessed with 8 children. One of her children is married and three are still minors. To support her family, she buys and sells bananas in her area. Her neighbors provide her banana supply. She started this buy and sell business 6 years ago. She now earns an average net income of PHP 2500.00 a month. She is also supported by her children who work for different employers. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just a year ago because she was interested in our products and services and because we are one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and won an award for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. As member of the PDP-LP Program, because of her outstanding credit record, she was able to borrow multiple loans. 

For her fourth loan, Julieta is privileged to to borrow PHP 14,000 to add her capital to her banana business. She will use the additional income that she earns from her investment for her family's basic needs and as savings for her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her banana business

loans.name: San

texts.en: San T. was born in 1975 and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married with four children, one of whom is married and other three of whom are single. Three of her children are employed selling souvenirs for tourists, while her husband, Mr. Ry, 37, is a motorcycle taxi driver. To generate her daily income, San T. depends on carrying fish for buyers at the market. However, San T. has never been able to cook because her house doesn't include a kitchen. Therefore, she requests her second loan to build a new kitchen.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida J. is a 67 year old married woman who lives in Brgy. Lag-asan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She runs a restaurant with her husband, Antonio's help. They have two children.  One has a family and the other goes to school and also helps his parents with the business as part of his daily chores.

Lida’s joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 to improve her family's quality of life.  With the help of loans from NWTF-PD, she has increased her family income.  Now, she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000.  Lida is a member in good standing. 

Her previous loan of Php  15,000 was used to fund the operations of her restaurant. She is currently borrowing Php 15,000 for her 16th loan to support her restaurant. Lida works hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations.  She wants a bright future and comfortable life for her family.
-------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow  Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women  through Project <i>Dungganon</i> (a Hiligaynon word that means  <u>Honorable</u>). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is  empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path  that will ultimately make them <i>Dungganon</i> - a title of esteem  that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through  a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Buy additional equipment for restaurant.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len C. is 43 years old and lives in the city of Phnom Penh.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 16 and 23.  Len is a housewife and her husband (pictured here) has been a fisherman since 1984.  He earns $2 a day by selling his catch to a local vendor who then resells the fish at a local market.  

The couple’s youngest child is in high school.  The three oldest children are employed as construction workers and in small shops.  They contribute to the family’s income and earn about $3 a day.  

Len requested her first loan of $1,000 from CREDIT MFI to purchase a boat for her husband.  This will enable him to fish in larger bodies of water.  He is currently limited to small ponds and streams.  She hopes this loan will help her husband’s business improve so they can invest more money in their child’s education.

loans.name: Veolita

texts.en:
Veolita O. is  a 59-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Brgy Maquiling Sagay City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store, a rice retailing shop, and a restaurant.

Veolita’s husband helps her run the businesses, and they have three children; two of them are already grown and the youngest is currently going to school. All of the children help their parents in the businesses as part of their daily chores.

Veolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 in the hope that she would be able to help her  husband improve the quality of life for their family. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,000 in her sixteenth cycle loan, which she  intends to use on her businesses. Veolita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and alimango for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

To make a living, Marvin owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Marvin has been involved in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 300 PHP weekly.

In 2009, Marvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marvin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Letecia A. is from the town of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Letecia is married and has one child. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily used products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.

Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Letecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
A good entrepreneur dreams to improve her business, support the education of her children and improve the living conditions of her family. She also plans to buy a canter truck to hasten the delivery of her products to different locations. She is 34 year-old Yolanda D., who lives in the village of Brgy. Guimbala-on Silay City Negros Occidental.

Her husband Welfredo drives the jeep they own to deliver the soft drinks that they sell on a wholesale basis to different vendors around town. Yolanda also sells the soft drinks retail to her neighbors.

The couple has 4 children who are between 6 and 18 years old. They all go to school at present. Yolanda and Welfredo already had this business even before she joined NWTF Project Dungganon in 2006, but it was the need for more capital to fund their expanding operations that prompted her to join. With the help of her loans she is able to purchase larger quantities of soft drinks to distribute to a network of regular stores that they have developed a relationship with over the years.

To supplement their income, Yolanda also sells fruits, such as bananas, and used clothes in the store adjacent to her house. She earns about PHP 9,550 from her business activities and it helps a lot in paying for the education of her children and defraying the household expenses while allowing her to save up for the future.

In her previous loan Php 23,000, she used it as additional working capital for her wholesale and retailing of soft drinks. The said amount was fully paid within her loan term, and contributed to the maintenance of her good credit performance with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Now she borrowing for her 8th cycle loan the amount of Php 25,000 which she intends to use to fund the buying and selling of bananas and purchase soft drinks in bulk. The income from it will be used to take the next steps in her journey toward the fulfillment of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
A 62 year old woman who built her own business for the sake of her family, Minda P. lives in the village of Brgy Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental. Her husband works as a fisherman and they are blessed with 9 children with ages from 26 to 37 years old.

Minda knew the hardship her husband went through just to earn enough to sustain the needs of their family. Because of their situation, Minda pursued her plan to get into a business to help her husband even with just a small income.

With a small amount of capital, she started a food vending business. In 1995 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have access to a bigger capital so she can expand her business by adding new kinds of food to sell. She would sell the food in the villages and towns near by. She would wake up early each morning to prepare the food to sell and prepare the food for her husband when he goes fishing.

She was able to improve their way of living through NWTF-Project Dungganon because of her continuous loans. She earned Php 15,000 per month that was mostly used for her family and for her children.

Minda's previous loan of Php 9,500 was used as additional capital for her food vending business which was paid on-time without delay. Now, with the same amount of Php 9,500, she would like to purchase additional ingredients and equipment for her food vending business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for food vending

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy crates of sodas, juice, and water to sell.

Elizabeth is 30 years old and single. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to go back to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern SuD.. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas, juice, and water to sell

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S. is a 41 year-old year old married woman who lives in Km 13, Brgy. Taloc Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and raising livestock.

Rosemarie’s husband, Rene, is a carpenter, and they have 3 children who are between 18 and 21 years old. Two of her children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in general store and livestock raising. Now she earns an average monthly income of 3,750 PHP from her business activities.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions.

Now Rosemarie is borrowing her 11th cycle loan in the amount of 21,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund additional inventory for her general store and as working capital for her livestock raising. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Maywah

texts.en:
Maywah P. is a 39-year old married woman who lives in the village of Cross Catalvas, Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a restaurant business and operating a rice farm.

Maywah’s husband helps her in running the business, especially in managing a "Habal Habal," a single motorcycle for passengers usually used in a mountainous areas.

They have 6 children; 3 are adults and the 3 younger children currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. 

Maywah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a restaurant business and operating a rice farm. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 5000 PHP from her business activities. 

Maywah is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 17000 PHP was used to fund operations for her restaurant, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions.

Now, she is borrowing her 10th loan in the amount of 20000 PHP which she intends to use on her restaurant and rice farm.

Maywah is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia A. lives in Villa Elena, Brgy. Tortosa, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She is married with 8 children who are between 17 to 37 years old, some of whom already have gainful work and have their own families.

She is 59 years old and still working to earn a living because she wants to save for her future and have financial security. She also desires for her business to bring progress to her family.

In 2002, Lucresia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to help her husband earn additional income for the family. When she received her loan, she put up a general store adjacent to her house.

As she continued to pay back her loans, she was granted new loans because of her good performance that showed that the loans helped to expand her business and she was able to add new products and gain more profit, with an average of Php 10,000 per month. The income gradually improved the quality of living for the family.

Lucresia's previous loan of 19500 PHP allowed her to expand her store by selling additional products that were in high demand in her community. The loan was paid on-time and in full.

Now she is borrowing her 12th loan for the same amount of 19500 PHP to purchase additional inventory for her general store. The income from the loan will help support them with their family needs.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 48 years old and resides in a rural area of Phnom Penh city, where many people earn a living as farmers. Keo S. and her husband depend on planting crops and catching fish in and around the river. They are able to generate $3 of income per day to manage their family’s living expenses. The couple has five children; three are married and two are single. Three of their children are employed; two work in Malaysia and one is a farmer. Keo S. is pursuing a loan for capital to grow a rice crop as the rice season approaches.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
You must do everything to sustain the family's needs, prepare for the children's future by sending them to school and to help your husband increase the household income.

This is what Janice T. believes. Admittedly, there was a time that she felt tired with her business but she said that it should not be the reason to stop because she knew that she had to do right for the sake of her children.

Janice is 29 years old, married to Donny and blessed with 3 school-age children. The family lives in the village of Nasug-ong, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

Janice receives a regular salary as a government employee but because she wants to improve her family's living conditions, she sells frozen food products to her co-employees and also operates a general store adjacent to her house.

She joined NWTF Project Dungganon in 2005 because she needed additional capital to sustain the growth of her frozen food business and her general store. Because of her strong entrepreneurial spirit, Janice earns an additional 4,000 PHP per month and she saves most of this for the education of her children.

Janice used her previous loan of 23,000 PHP to expand her general store. The said amount was fully paid through weekly installments. Now she is borrowing for her 15th cycle loan the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for her frozen food business.

loans.name: Massiatou

texts.fr: A. Massiatou est née le 20 Septembre 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Massiatou vit depuis 16 ans à Gbégamey, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à QUENUM Richard, un promoteur d'artistes, Massiatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Massiatou a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Massiatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Massiatou a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Depuis 14 ans, Massiatou vend des CD et des cassettes à son domicile. Massiatou mène égalment comme activité, la vente d'oeufs et du miel. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Massiatou fait ses achats. Massiatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement trois crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est dans le but d'augmenter son capital et d'agrandir davantage son activité, que Massiatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Massiatou A. was born on September 20, 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Massiatou has lived for 16 years in Gbégamey, a quarter in Cotonou. She is married to Richard Quenum, an art promoter. She is the mother of three children, all in school. Massiatou takes care of another child in addition to her own children. She lives together with her children and her husband. Together, the couple supports the family. Massiatou attended school until high school. For 14 years, she has sold CDs and cassettes from her home. In addition, she sells eggs and honey. Massiatou does her shopping in Nigeria, a country which neighbors Bénin, and in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She is an old client of ALIDé, having previously obtained three loans from them which she reimbursed in full. She is asking for a fourth loan with the goal of increasing her capital and growing her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of CDs, blank CDs, and cartons of eggs.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia F. earns her living through dressmaking. She is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Shopping Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Anastacia’s husband, Efren, helps run the business and they have four children between the ages of 20 and 27 years old. The older two already work as teachers and are helping their younger siblings finish their college education. The two younger children are currently going to school and also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.

Anastacia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by making full use of her dressmaking skills. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Anastacia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her dressmaking business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing 19,500 PHP for her 10th loan cycle, which she intends to use on her dressmaking business. Anastacia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. In 2009, Nelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Nelda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make products to sell. This loan, her first from HSPFI, will allow her to generate additional income to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Hat's Group

texts.en:
Hat T. N. is 47 years old. She makes a living as a farmer, growing vegetables, and also breeds animals. She lives with her husband, who works in construction, and their two children. Sometimes, she and her husband help each other in their work. They have an income of about 4,000,000 VND and have worked hard to raise their children. She also leads a five-member loan group which is active in SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She has applied for a loan of 7,194,000 VND (or $385) to use breeding animals.

The other members of her group are:
Huong T. D., who is 46 years old. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND ( or $225) to grow vegetables and for other business purposes.
Hien T. N. is 51 years old and wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (or $340) to breed the pigs and poultry.
Thoa T. D. is 41 years old and wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND (or $400) to invest in her farm.
Dich T. N. is 56 years old and wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or $225) to breed the pigs and fish.

loans.use: to breeding

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He is a hardworking man. His wife is a trader, and she sells groceries to support her home. Friday hopes to own a big stall in the future. He needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda G. is a 45-year-old woman who has dedicated her life to making things better for her family and helping them escape from poverty. She will do all she can to meet these goals, and especially wants her children to finish their studies and have a better future. Her husband, Ereneo, makes a living driving a sugarcane truck during milling season. When the mills close for the season, he drives a motorcycle and sometimes helps his wife with her business. The couple is blessed with five children, some of whom are still in school. They live in the village of Sitio Nasug-ong, Brgy Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

To help her husband meet their family's needs, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 to earn additional income. She began by buying and selling fruit in front of their house. Then she began selling clothing, where she earned enough money to help tremendously with her family's needs. As she secured additional loans, she looked for other ways to earn money. Now she makes a living selling fish to people in her local community. From this businesses, she earns a minimum of PHP 11,800 per month.  This has allowed her to educate her children and meet many household expenses. 

Florenda's previous loan of Php19,500 was used for her fish-selling business. She paid it on time and without any delay. Now she has applied for a new loan of PHP 19,500 which we will use to sell fruits and selling of fruits and clothing.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges,  Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in  the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its programs, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a  life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and clothing to sell

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana D. U. has a lot of faith and courage, and they have helped her overcome the poverty that afflicts her family. She is 60 years old and married to Jose, who is 59 years old and a motorcycle driver. Cresenciana has three daughters and three grandchildren, all of whom look to her for support. She lives in the town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in order to secure access to capital for her business, which consists of raising hogs. This loan is her ninth, and she has repaid all the previous ones on time and maD. good use of them to expand her business and her income. She has applied for a new loan of PHP 35,000 to buy eight piglets, 10 sacks of feed and vitamins, and to pay for transportation expenses. 

She dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged pig farm. She also dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find good and stable jobs. Until that happens, she is pleased at the way in which ASHI and Kiva have changed her family's life and given them a chance to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for eight piglets, 10 sacks of feed, vitamins and transportation costs

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis R. makes a living selling charcoal from her home and is applying for a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Khamis is 40 years old and married to a potter. She has 8 children, all of whom are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family to live in.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Dolores Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Nena is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the business's main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the eleventh loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lep

texts.en: Lep A., 39, is a widower and the father of four children. Three of his children are married and have already started new homes, while other is single and lives at home. Lep A. lives with his older mother, who sells traditional medicine to earn a living. To make a living, Lep A. sells silk that he orders in bulk from weavers. He sells his goods in various provinces and earns an average of $6 a day. Lep A. wants to sustain his business growth and is asking for a loan to accumulate a larger amount of silk to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger amount of silk to sell

Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. She says her business is growing, but her major challenge is insufficient capital to boost her business. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more clothes and bags to sell.  This is the high season for business and she hopes to make more profits. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags to sell
